WaterIsotopes.name: Delta_13C_HCO3
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic Ratio of 13-C:HCO3 in carbonate minerals, reported in parts per thousand (per mil).

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta_13Cmineral_carbonate
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic Ratio of 13-C:12-C in carbonate minerals. In geochemistry, paleoclimatology and paleoceanography 13-C is an isotopic signature, a measure of the ratio of stable isotopes 13-C:12-C, reported in parts per thousand (per mil).

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta_13Ctotal_dissolved
WaterIsotopes.description: Ratio of 13-C:12-C in solution. Carbon-13 (13C) is a natural, stable isotope of carbon and one of the environmental isotopes.

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta18O_sulfate
WaterIsotopes.description: The delta 18-O value in sulfate.

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta18Omineral_sulfate
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic Ratio of 18-O:16-O in sulfate.

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta34S
WaterIsotopes.description: Report in ppm.

WaterIsotopes.name: r11B_10B
WaterIsotopes.description: Carbon-14 as a percent of modern carbon, calibrated. Carbon-14, 14C, or radiocarbon, is a radioactive isotope of carbon with a nucleus containing 6 protons and 8 neutrons.

WaterIsotopes.name: r14C_pctModern
WaterIsotopes.description: Carbon-14 as a percent of modern carbon, calibrated.  Carbon-14, 14C, or radiocarbon, is a radioactive isotope of carbon with a nucleus containing 6 protons and 8 neutrons.

WaterIsotopes.name: r206Pb_204Pb_diss
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic Ratio of 206-Pb : 204-Pb dissolved in solution. Lead (Pb) has four stable isotopes: 204Pb, 206Pb, 207Pb, 208Pb. Lead-204 is entirely a primordial nuclide and none of it is radiogenic. The isotopes lead-206, lead-207, and lead-208 represent the ends of decay chains called the uranium series (or radium series), the thorium series, and the actinium series respectively. These series represent the decay chain products of long-lived primoridal U-238, U-235, and Th-232 respectively.

WaterIsotopes.name: r206Pb_204Pb_rock

Lead-204 is entirely a primordial nuclide and none of it is radiogenic. The isotopes lead-206, lead-207, and lead-208 represent the ends of decay chains called the uranium series (or radium series), the thorium series, and the actinium series respectively. These series represent the decay chain products of long-lived primoridal U-238, U-235, and Th-232 respectively.

GasIsotopes.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

GasIsotopes.name: OtherAnalyticalData
GasIsotopes.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

GasIsotopes.name: DrilledDepth_ft
GasIsotopes.description: Length of borehole from borehole origin to bottom of borehole. If there are multiple wells, use the depth of the deepest well.

GasIsotopes.name: FluidTemperature_C
GasIsotopes.description: Temperature of fluid, in decimal format,  when sampled; all temperatures must be reported in degrees Celsius.

GasIsotopes.name: Discharge
GasIsotopes.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

GasIsotopes.name: DischargeUnits
GasIsotopes.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

GasIsotopes.name: County
GasIsotopes.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

GasIsotopes.name: State
GasIsotopes.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

GasIsotopes.name: LatDegree
GasIsotopes.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GasIsotopes.name: LongDegree
GasIsotopes.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GasIsotopes.name: SRS
GasIsotopes.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

GasIsotopes.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
GasIsotopes.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

GasIsotopes.name: PLSSMeridians
GasIsotopes.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

GasIsotopes.name: Township
GasIsotopes.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

GasIsotopes.name: Range
GasIsotopes.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

GasIsotopes.name: Section_
GasIsotopes.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

GasIsotopes.name: SectionPart
GasIsotopes.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

GasIsotopes.name: Elevation_ft_msl
GasIsotopes.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

GasIsotopes.name: Source
GasIsotopes.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

GasIsotopes.name: SourceURI
GasIsotopes.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

GasIsotopes.name: MetadataURI
GasIsotopes.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

GasIsotopes.name: AnalysisDateTime
GasIsotopes.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GasIsotopes.name: Laboratory
GasIsotopes.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

GasIsotopes.name: AnalyticalProcedure
GasIsotopes.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta13C_CO2
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 13-C as CO2. Carbon-13 (13C) is a natural, stable isotope of carbon and one of the environmental isotopes.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta13C_CH4
GasIsotopes.description: The delta 13-C value in CH4.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta144Nd_143Nd
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 144Nd/143Nd ratio.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta15N_N2
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 15N/N2 ratio. There are two stable isotopes of nitrogen: 14N and 15N.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta18O_CO2
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 18-O/CO2. In geochemistry, paleoclimatology and paleoceanography delta-O-18 is a measure of the ratio of stable isotopes 18O:16O.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta34S_H2S
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 34S/H2S ratio.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta34S_SO4
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 34S/SO4 ratio.

GasIsotopes.name: r3He_4He
GasIsotopes.description: Isotopic ratios for the helium isotopes 3-He:4-He in a rock sample.

GasIsotopes.name: Shape
GasIsotopes.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

IsotopesDissolved.name: OBJECTID
IsotopesDissolved.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

IsotopesDissolved.name: AnalysisURI
IsotopesDissolved.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

IsotopesDissolved.name: AnalysisName
IsotopesDissolved.description: Other human-intelligible labels for analysis such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. (If there are multiple analyses performed on a single sample, each analysis would correspond to a new line of data in the template.)

IsotopesDissolved.name: Notes
IsotopesDissolved.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SamplingFeatureName
IsotopesDissolved.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SamplingFeatureURI
IsotopesDissolved.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SamplingFeatureType
IsotopesDissolved.description: Type of feature that is the subject of this record: Thermal Spring, Borehole, Well, Pool, Stream.

IsotopesDissolved.name: OtherSiteID
IsotopesDissolved.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SpecimenID
IsotopesDissolved.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

IsotopesDissolved.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature, any special considerations with this instance (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

IsotopesDissolved.name: Delta18O_H2O
IsotopesDissolved.description: Delta 18-O in water.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Delta18O_steam
IsotopesDissolved.description: Delta 18-O in steam.

IsotopesDissolved.name: DeltaDeuterium_H2O
IsotopesDissolved.description: Deuterium in water; often used as a tracer in groundwater hydrology, deterium can be found in most natural waters (a.k.a. "Heavy Water").

IsotopesDissolved.name: DeltaDeuterium_steam
IsotopesDissolved.description: Deuterium in steam; often used as a tracer in groundwater hydrology, deterium can be found in most natural waters (a.k.a. "Heavy Water").

IsotopesDissolved.name: r18O_16O
IsotopesDissolved.description: Isotopic ratios 18-O:16-O for the stable isotope O.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Rn222_pCiL

IsotopesDissolved.name: Te_mgL
IsotopesDissolved.description: Report analyte as percent.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Th_mgL

IsotopesDissolved.name: TotalRa_pCiL

IsotopesDissolved.name: Tritium_TU

SingleAnalyte.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

SingleAnalyte.name: AnalyticalProcedure
SingleAnalyte.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

SingleAnalyte.name: analyte
SingleAnalyte.description: Specifies the analyte described by this suite.

SingleAnalyte.name: result
SingleAnalyte.description: Text field describing the results of the single analyte analysis.

SingleAnalyte.name: units
SingleAnalyte.description: Units reported in the single analyte analysis.

SingleAnalyte.name: uncertainty
SingleAnalyte.description: Measure of uncertainty of the results.

SingleAnalyte.name: qualifier
SingleAnalyte.description: Statement regarding the single analyte.

SingleAnalyte.name: measurementMethod
SingleAnalyte.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check. If following a paper or standard include reference.

SingleAnalyte.name: Shape
SingleAnalyte.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

WaterQuality.name: OBJECTID
WaterQuality.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

WaterQuality.name: AnalysisURI
WaterQuality.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

WaterQuality.name: AnalysisName
WaterQuality.description: Other human-intelligible labels for analysis such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. (If there are multiple analyses performed on a single sample, each analysis would correspond to a new line of data in the template.)

WaterQuality.name: Notes
WaterQuality.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

WaterQuality.name: SamplingFeatureName
WaterQuality.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

WaterQuality.name: SamplingFeatureURI
WaterQuality.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

WaterQuality.name: SamplingFeatureType
WaterQuality.description: Type of feature that is the subject of this record: Thermal Spring, Borehole, Well, Pool, Stream.

WaterQuality.name: OtherSiteID
WaterQuality.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

WaterQuality.name: SpecimenID
WaterQuality.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

WaterQuality.name: Label
WaterQuality.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

WaterQuality.name: SpecimenDescription
WaterQuality.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature, any special considerations with this instance (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

WaterQuality.name: SpecimenURI
WaterQuality.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

WaterQuality.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
WaterQuality.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

WaterQuality.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
WaterQuality.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WaterQuality.name: OtherAnalyticalData
WaterQuality.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

WaterQuality.name: DrilledDepth_ft
WaterQuality.description: Length of borehole from borehole origin to bottom of borehole. If there are multiple wells, use the depth of the deepest well.

WaterQuality.name: FluidTemperature_C
WaterQuality.description: Temperature of fluid, in decimal format,  when sampled; all temperatures must be reported in degrees Celsius.

WaterQuality.name: Discharge
WaterQuality.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

WaterQuality.name: DischargeUnits
WaterQuality.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

WaterQuality.name: County
WaterQuality.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

WaterQuality.name: State
WaterQuality.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

WaterQuality.name: LatDegree
WaterQuality.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

WaterQuality.name: LongDegree
WaterQuality.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

WaterQuality.name: SRS
WaterQuality.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

WaterQuality.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
WaterQuality.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

WaterQuality.name: PLSSMeridians
WaterQuality.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

WaterQuality.name: Township
WaterQuality.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

WaterQuality.name: Range
WaterQuality.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

WaterQuality.name: Section_
WaterQuality.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

WaterQuality.name: SectionPart
WaterQuality.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

WaterQuality.name: Elevation_ft_msl
WaterQuality.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

WaterQuality.name: Source
WaterQuality.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

WaterQuality.name: SourceURI
WaterQuality.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

WaterQuality.name: MetadataURI
WaterQuality.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

WaterQuality.name: AnalysisDateTime
WaterQuality.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

WaterQuality.name: Laboratory
WaterQuality.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

WaterQuality.name: AnalyticalProcedure
WaterQuality.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WaterQuality.name: ph_Field
WaterQuality.description: Field measure of the acidity of an aqueous solution. Report in standard pH format.

WaterQuality.name: ph_Lab
WaterQuality.description: Field measure of the acidity of an aqueous solution. Report in standard pH format.

WaterQuality.name: SpecificConductance_mS
WaterQuality.description: Measurement of the ability of a substance to conduct electricity. Reported in S/m (Siemens/meter).

WaterQuality.name: ConductanceNote
WaterQuality.description: Notes on specific conductance measurements.

WaterQuality.name: Conductance_method
WaterQuality.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WaterQuality.name: TotalDissolvedSolids_mgL
WaterQuality.description: Total dissolved solids reported in mg/L.

WaterQuality.name: TotalDissolvedSolids_method
WaterQuality.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WaterQuality.name: TotalSuspendedSolids_mgL
WaterQuality.description: Total suspended solids reported in mg/L.

WaterQuality.name: TotalSuspendedSolids_method
WaterQuality.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WaterQuality.name: Turbidity_ntu
WaterQuality.description: Nephelometric (ntu) refers to the way the instrument, a nephelometer, measures how much light is scattered by suspended particles in the water. The greater the scattering, the higher the turbidity. Therefore, low NTU values indicate high water clarity, while high NTU values indicate low water clarity.

WaterQuality.name: Turbidity_method
WaterQuality.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WaterQuality.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

BaseMetals.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
BaseMetals.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

BaseMetals.name: OtherAnalyticalData
BaseMetals.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

BaseMetals.name: DrilledDepth_ft
BaseMetals.description: Length of borehole from borehole origin to bottom of borehole. If there are multiple wells, use the depth of the deepest well.

BaseMetals.name: FluidTemperature_C
BaseMetals.description: Temperature of fluid, in decimal format,  when sampled; all temperatures must be reported in degrees Celsius.

BaseMetals.name: Discharge
BaseMetals.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

BaseMetals.name: DischargeUnits
BaseMetals.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

BaseMetals.name: County
BaseMetals.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

BaseMetals.name: State
BaseMetals.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

BaseMetals.name: LatDegree
BaseMetals.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

BaseMetals.name: LongDegree
BaseMetals.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

BaseMetals.name: SRS
BaseMetals.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

BaseMetals.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
BaseMetals.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

BaseMetals.name: PLSSMeridians
BaseMetals.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

BaseMetals.name: Township
BaseMetals.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

BaseMetals.name: Range
BaseMetals.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

BaseMetals.name: Section_
BaseMetals.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

BaseMetals.name: SectionPart
BaseMetals.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

BaseMetals.name: Elevation_ft_msl
BaseMetals.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

BaseMetals.name: Source
BaseMetals.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

BaseMetals.name: SourceURI
BaseMetals.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

BaseMetals.name: MetadataURI
BaseMetals.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

BaseMetals.name: AnalysisDateTime
BaseMetals.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

BaseMetals.name: Laboratory
BaseMetals.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

BaseMetals.name: AnalyticalProcedure
BaseMetals.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

BaseMetals.name: Shape
BaseMetals.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: OBJECTID
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: AnalysisURI
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: AnalysisName
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Other human-intelligible labels for analysis such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. (If there are multiple analyses performed on a single sample, each analysis would correspond to a new line of data in the template.)

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: Notes
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: SamplingFeatureName
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: SamplingFeatureURI
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: SamplingFeatureType
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Type of feature that is the subject of this record: Thermal Spring, Borehole, Well, Pool, Stream.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: OtherSiteID
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: SpecimenID
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: Label
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: SpecimenDescription
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature, any special considerations with this instance (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: SpecimenURI
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

MajorDissolvedConstituents.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
MajorDissolvedConstituents.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: Range
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: Section_
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: SectionPart
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: Elevation_ft_msl
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: Source
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: SourceURI
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: MetadataURI
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: AnalysisDateTime
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: Laboratory
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

MinorDissolvedConstituents.name: AnalyticalProcedure
MinorDissolvedConstituents.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

Nitrogen.name: OBJECTID
Nitrogen.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

Nitrogen.name: AnalysisURI
Nitrogen.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

Nitrogen.name: AnalysisName
Nitrogen.description: Other human-intelligible labels for analysis such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. (If there are multiple analyses performed on a single sample, each analysis would correspond to a new line of data in the template.)

Nitrogen.name: Notes
Nitrogen.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

Nitrogen.name: SamplingFeatureName
Nitrogen.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

Nitrogen.name: SamplingFeatureURI
Nitrogen.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

Nitrogen.name: SamplingFeatureType
Nitrogen.description: Type of feature that is the subject of this record: Thermal Spring, Borehole, Well, Pool, Stream.

Nitrogen.name: OtherSiteID
Nitrogen.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

Nitrogen.name: SpecimenID
Nitrogen.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

Nitrogen.name: Label
Nitrogen.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

Nitrogen.name: SpecimenDescription
Nitrogen.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature, any special considerations with this instance (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

Nitrogen.name: SpecimenURI
Nitrogen.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

Nitrogen.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
Nitrogen.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

Nitrogen.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
Nitrogen.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

Nitrogen.name: OtherAnalyticalData
Nitrogen.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

Nitrogen.name: DrilledDepth_ft
Nitrogen.description: Length of borehole from borehole origin to bottom of borehole. If there are multiple wells, use the depth of the deepest well.

Nitrogen.name: FluidTemperature_C
Nitrogen.description: Temperature of fluid, in decimal format,  when sampled; all temperatures must be reported in degrees Celsius.

Nitrogen.name: Discharge
Nitrogen.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

Nitrogen.name: DischargeUnits
Nitrogen.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

Nitrogen.name: County
Nitrogen.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

Nitrogen.name: State
Nitrogen.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

Nitrogen.name: LatDegree
Nitrogen.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

Nitrogen.name: LongDegree
Nitrogen.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

Nitrogen.name: SRS
Nitrogen.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

Nitrogen.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
Nitrogen.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

Nitrogen.name: PLSSMeridians
Nitrogen.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

Nitrogen.name: Township
Nitrogen.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

Nitrogen.name: Range
Nitrogen.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

Nitrogen.name: Section_
Nitrogen.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

Nitrogen.name: SectionPart
Nitrogen.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

Nitrogen.name: Elevation_ft_msl
Nitrogen.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

Nitrogen.name: Source
Nitrogen.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

Nitrogen.name: SourceURI
Nitrogen.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

Nitrogen.name: MetadataURI
Nitrogen.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

Nitrogen.name: AnalysisDateTime
Nitrogen.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

Nitrogen.name: Laboratory
Nitrogen.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

Nitrogen.name: AnalyticalProcedure
Nitrogen.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

Nitrogen.name: N_Kjeldahl_mgL
Nitrogen.description: Total Kjeldahl Nitrogen or TKN is the sum of organic nitrogen, ammonia (NH3), and ammonium (NH4+) in the chemical analysis of soil, water, or wastewater (e.g. sewage treatment plant effluent). To calculate Total Nitrogen (TN), the concentrations of nitrate-N and nitrite-N are determined and added to TKN. TKN is determined in the same manner as organic nitrogen, except that the ammonia is not driven off before the digestion step. Reported in mg/L.

Nitrogen.name: NH4_as_N_mgL
Nitrogen.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

Nitrogen.name: NH4_mgL
Nitrogen.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

Nitrogen.name: Nitrate_field_mgL
Nitrogen.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

Nitrogen.name: Nitrate_lab_mgL
Nitrogen.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

Nitrogen.name: NitratePlusNitrite_mgL
Nitrogen.description: Nitrate NO3 plus Nitrite NO2 in mg/L.  Reported in mg/L.

Nitrogen.name: Nitrite_field_mgL
Nitrogen.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

Nitrogen.name: Nitrite_lab_mgL
Nitrogen.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

Nitrogen.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

FreeGas.name: SamplingFeatureType
FreeGas.description: Type of feature that is the subject of this record: Thermal Spring, Borehole, Well, Pool, Stream.

FreeGas.name: OtherSiteID
FreeGas.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

FreeGas.name: SpecimenID
FreeGas.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

FreeGas.name: Label
FreeGas.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

FreeGas.name: SpecimenDescription
FreeGas.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature, any special considerations with this instance (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

FreeGas.name: SpecimenURI
FreeGas.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

FreeGas.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
FreeGas.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

FreeGas.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
FreeGas.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

FreeGas.name: OtherAnalyticalData
FreeGas.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

FreeGas.name: DrilledDepth_ft
FreeGas.description: Length of borehole from borehole origin to bottom of borehole. If there are multiple wells, use the depth of the deepest well.

FreeGas.name: FluidTemperature_C
FreeGas.description: Temperature of fluid, in decimal format,  when sampled; all temperatures must be reported in degrees Celsius.

FreeGas.name: Discharge
FreeGas.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

FreeGas.name: DischargeUnits
FreeGas.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

FreeGas.name: County
FreeGas.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

FreeGas.name: State
FreeGas.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

FreeGas.name: LatDegree
FreeGas.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

FreeGas.name: LongDegree
FreeGas.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

FreeGas.name: SRS
FreeGas.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

FreeGas.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
FreeGas.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

FreeGas.name: PLSSMeridians
FreeGas.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

FreeGas.name: Township
FreeGas.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

FreeGas.name: Range
FreeGas.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

FreeGas.name: Section_
FreeGas.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

FreeGas.name: SectionPart
FreeGas.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

FreeGas.name: Elevation_ft_msl
FreeGas.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

FreeGas.name: Source
FreeGas.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

FreeGas.name: SourceURI
FreeGas.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

FreeGas.name: MetadataURI
FreeGas.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

FreeGas.name: AnalysisDateTime
FreeGas.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

FreeGas.name: Laboratory
FreeGas.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

FreeGas.name: AnalyticalProcedure
FreeGas.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

FreeGas.name: Ar_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: C2H6_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: CH4_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: CO2_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: H2_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: H2S_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: He_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: Kr_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: N2_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: Ne_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: NH3_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: NO_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: O2_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

FreeGas.name: O2plusAr_volpct
FreeGas.description: Oxygen as O2 plus Ar. Reported as a volume percent.

FreeGas.name: SO2_volpct
FreeGas.description: Report analyte as percent.

FreeGas.name: TotalFreeGas_volpct
FreeGas.description: Dissolved gas, reported as a volume percent.

FreeGas.name: Shape
FreeGas.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

WaterIsotopes.name: OBJECTID
WaterIsotopes.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

WaterIsotopes.name: AnalysisURI
WaterIsotopes.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

WaterIsotopes.name: AnalysisName
WaterIsotopes.description: Other human-intelligible labels for analysis such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. (If there are multiple analyses performed on a single sample, each analysis would correspond to a new line of data in the template.)

WaterIsotopes.name: Notes
WaterIsotopes.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta_13C_HCO3
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic Ratio of 13-C:HCO3 in carbonate minerals, reported in parts per thousand (per mil).

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta_13Cmineral_carbonate
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic Ratio of 13-C:12-C in carbonate minerals. In geochemistry, paleoclimatology and paleoceanography 13-C is an isotopic signature, a measure of the ratio of stable isotopes 13-C:12-C, reported in parts per thousand (per mil).

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta_13Ctotal_dissolved
WaterIsotopes.description: Ratio of 13-C:12-C in solution. Carbon-13 (13C) is a natural, stable isotope of carbon and one of the environmental isotopes.

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta18O_sulfate
WaterIsotopes.description: The delta 18-O value in sulfate.

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta18Omineral_sulfate
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic Ratio of 18-O:16-O in sulfate.

WaterIsotopes.name: Delta34S
WaterIsotopes.description: Report in ppm.

WaterIsotopes.name: r11B_10B
WaterIsotopes.description: Carbon-14 as a percent of modern carbon, calibrated. Carbon-14, 14C, or radiocarbon, is a radioactive isotope of carbon with a nucleus containing 6 protons and 8 neutrons.

WaterIsotopes.name: r14C_pctModern
WaterIsotopes.description: Carbon-14 as a percent of modern carbon, calibrated.  Carbon-14, 14C, or radiocarbon, is a radioactive isotope of carbon with a nucleus containing 6 protons and 8 neutrons.

WaterIsotopes.name: r206Pb_204Pb_diss
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic Ratio of 206-Pb : 204-Pb dissolved in solution. Lead (Pb) has four stable isotopes: 204Pb, 206Pb, 207Pb, 208Pb. Lead-204 is entirely a primordial nuclide and none of it is radiogenic. The isotopes lead-206, lead-207, and lead-208 represent the ends of decay chains called the uranium series (or radium series), the thorium series, and the actinium series respectively. These series represent the decay chain products of long-lived primoridal U-238, U-235, and Th-232 respectively.

WaterIsotopes.name: r206Pb_204Pb_rock
WaterIsotopes.description: Isotopic ratio of 207-Pb : 204-Pb in a rock sample. Lead (Pb) has four stable isotopes: 204Pb, 206Pb, 207Pb, 208Pb. Lead-204 is entirely a primordial nuclide and none of it is radiogenic. The isotopes lead-206, lead-207, and lead-208 represent the ends of decay chains called the uranium series (or radium series), the thorium series, and the actinium series respectively. These series represent the decay chain products of long-lived primoridal U-238, U-235, and Th-232 respectively.
