GasIsotopes.name: DischargeUnits
GasIsotopes.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

GasIsotopes.name: County
GasIsotopes.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

GasIsotopes.name: State
GasIsotopes.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

GasIsotopes.name: LatDegree
GasIsotopes.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GasIsotopes.name: LongDegree
GasIsotopes.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GasIsotopes.name: SRS
GasIsotopes.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

GasIsotopes.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
GasIsotopes.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

GasIsotopes.name: PLSSMeridians
GasIsotopes.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

GasIsotopes.name: Township
GasIsotopes.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

GasIsotopes.name: Range
GasIsotopes.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

GasIsotopes.name: Section_
GasIsotopes.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

GasIsotopes.name: SectionPart
GasIsotopes.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

GasIsotopes.name: Elevation_ft_msl
GasIsotopes.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

GasIsotopes.name: Source
GasIsotopes.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

GasIsotopes.name: SourceURI
GasIsotopes.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

GasIsotopes.name: MetadataURI
GasIsotopes.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

GasIsotopes.name: AnalysisDateTime
GasIsotopes.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GasIsotopes.name: Laboratory
GasIsotopes.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

GasIsotopes.name: AnalyticalProcedure
GasIsotopes.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta13C_CO2
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 13-C as CO2. Carbon-13 (13C) is a natural, stable isotope of carbon and one of the environmental isotopes.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta13C_CH4
GasIsotopes.description: The delta 13-C value in CH4.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta144Nd_143Nd
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 144Nd/143Nd ratio.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta15N_N2
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 15N/N2 ratio. There are two stable isotopes of nitrogen: 14N and 15N.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta18O_CO2
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 18-O/CO2. In geochemistry, paleoclimatology and paleoceanography delta-O-18 is a measure of the ratio of stable isotopes 18O:16O.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta34S_H2S
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 34S/H2S ratio.

GasIsotopes.name: Delta34S_SO4
GasIsotopes.description: Delta 34S/SO4 ratio.

GasIsotopes.name: r3He_4He
GasIsotopes.description: Isotopic ratios for the helium isotopes 3-He:4-He in a rock sample.

GasIsotopes.name: Shape
GasIsotopes.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

IsotopesDissolved.name: OBJECTID
IsotopesDissolved.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

IsotopesDissolved.name: AnalysisURI
IsotopesDissolved.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

IsotopesDissolved.name: AnalysisName
IsotopesDissolved.description: Other human-intelligible labels for analysis such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. (If there are multiple analyses performed on a single sample, each analysis would correspond to a new line of data in the template.)

IsotopesDissolved.name: Notes
IsotopesDissolved.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SamplingFeatureName
IsotopesDissolved.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SamplingFeatureURI
IsotopesDissolved.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SamplingFeatureType
IsotopesDissolved.description: Type of feature that is the subject of this record: Thermal Spring, Borehole, Well, Pool, Stream.

IsotopesDissolved.name: OtherSiteID
IsotopesDissolved.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SpecimenID
IsotopesDissolved.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Label
IsotopesDissolved.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SpecimenDescription
IsotopesDissolved.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature, any special considerations with this instance (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

IsotopesDissolved.name: SpecimenURI
IsotopesDissolved.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
IsotopesDissolved.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

IsotopesDissolved.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
IsotopesDissolved.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

IsotopesDissolved.name: OtherAnalyticalData
IsotopesDissolved.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

IsotopesDissolved.name: DrilledDepth_ft
IsotopesDissolved.description: Length of borehole from borehole origin to bottom of borehole. If there are multiple wells, use the depth of the deepest well.

IsotopesDissolved.name: FluidTemperature_C
IsotopesDissolved.description: Temperature of fluid, in decimal format,  when sampled; all temperatures must be reported in degrees Celsius.

IsotopesDissolved.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

IsotopesDissolved.name: AlphaParticleActivity_pCiL
IsotopesDissolved.description: Alpha particles are a form of ionizing radiation that is given off by radioactive materials such as uranium and radon. Reported in PicoCuries per liter.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Delta18O_H2O
IsotopesDissolved.description: Delta 18-O in water.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Delta18O_steam
IsotopesDissolved.description: Delta 18-O in steam.

IsotopesDissolved.name: DeltaDeuterium_H2O
IsotopesDissolved.description: Deuterium in water; often used as a tracer in groundwater hydrology, deterium can be found in most natural waters (a.k.a. "Heavy Water").

IsotopesDissolved.name: DeltaDeuterium_steam
IsotopesDissolved.description: Deuterium in steam; often used as a tracer in groundwater hydrology, deterium can be found in most natural waters (a.k.a. "Heavy Water").

IsotopesDissolved.name: r18O_16O
IsotopesDissolved.description: Isotopic ratios 18-O:16-O for the stable isotope O.

IsotopesDissolved.name: r234U_238U
IsotopesDissolved.description: Isotopic ratio of uranium-234:uranium-238.

IsotopesDissolved.name: r3H_2H

IsotopesDissolved.name: r3He_4He

IsotopesDissolved.name: r3He_2He

IsotopesDissolved.name: Ra226Total_pCiL
IsotopesDissolved.description: Total radium-226 reported in PicoCuries per liter.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Rn222_pCiL
IsotopesDissolved.description: Total radon-222 reported in PicoCuries per liter.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Te_mgL
IsotopesDissolved.description: Report analyte as percent.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Th_mgL
IsotopesDissolved.description: Report analyte as percent.

IsotopesDissolved.name: TotalRa_pCiL
IsotopesDissolved.description: Total radium reported in PicoCuries per liter.

IsotopesDissolved.name: Tritium_TU
IsotopesDissolved.description: Tritium measured in Tritium Units, where 1 TU is defined as the ratio of 1 tritium atom to 1018 hydrogen atoms.

IsotopesDissolved.name: U_activity_pCiL
IsotopesDissolved.description: Uranium as reported in PicoCuries per liter.

IsotopesDissolved.name: U_mgL

SingleAnalyte.name: measurementMethod
SingleAnalyte.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check. If following a paper or standard include reference.

SingleAnalyte.name: Shape
SingleAnalyte.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: OBJECTID
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: AnalysisURI
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: AnalysisName
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Other human-intelligible labels for analysis such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. (If there are multiple analyses performed on a single sample, each analysis would correspond to a new line of data in the template.)

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Notes
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SamplingFeatureName
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SamplingFeatureURI
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SamplingFeatureType
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Type of feature that is the subject of this record: Thermal Spring, Borehole, Well, Pool, Stream.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: OtherSiteID
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SpecimenID
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Label
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SpecimenDescription
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature, any special considerations with this instance (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SpecimenURI
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: OtherAnalyticalData
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: DrilledDepth_ft
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Length of borehole from borehole origin to bottom of borehole. If there are multiple wells, use the depth of the deepest well.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: FluidTemperature_C
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Temperature of fluid, in decimal format,  when sampled; all temperatures must be reported in degrees Celsius.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Discharge
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: DischargeUnits
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: County
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: State
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: LatDegree
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: LongDegree
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SRS
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: PLSSMeridians
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Township
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Range
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Section_
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SectionPart
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Elevation_ft_msl
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Source
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: SourceURI
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: MetadataURI
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: AnalysisDateTime
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Laboratory
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: AnalyticalProcedure
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Units
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Indicate the units of the analytes in this section (layer). If mutliple units are used, indicate here.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: FluidOrigin
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: magmatic, meteoric, etc. List if multiple possible sources.

MineralRecoveryBrine.name: Shape
MineralRecoveryBrine.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: aqueouschemistry

status: Currently, services are deployed using version 1.1, which is in review with the working group GDSDPWG.
description: This workbook contains the BoreholeLithIntercept content model that specifies content elements for an interchange format for lithology log intercepts associated with a borehole. Fields in the BoreholeLithIntercept Content model will become XML elements in interchange documents for WFS simple features served by AASG-geothermal-data web services.  Each intercept feature has a depth coordinate measured from the ground surface along the well bore (convention for interoperability) and a geologic unit specified that will be identical with the content associated with contacts on a geologic map.  Other sheets in the workbook provide additional explanatory material and provide information on the origin of the dataset, its review and lineage.
title: Borehole Lithology Intercepts
discussion: This template defines the content model for a service that delivers borehole lithology intercept observations. Many of these will be standard depth to intercept formations, formation name and measurement procedure, but other information may be delivered. Much of the variation will concern procedures used to recorded the information, citations, and possible other collected data that may be useful for geothermal resource research. The  content model should be used when compiling geologic data from published reports, databases, logging events and field notes. The content model presented here is intended to present key information necessary to query a lithology intercept observation service and to evaluate the data.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: OBJECTID
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: BHInterceptURI
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Unique identifier that specifies the  borehole intercept. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: WellName
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: APINo
BoreholeLithIntercept.description:
API number for the the wellbore/borehole identified by the HeaderURI. If an API number is unavailable this field is empty. Usage of hyphens is optional, according to standard practice in each state. API number refers to the American Petroleum Institute number. Each oil, gas, or geothermal well drilled in the United States has a unique API number; this number identifies all boreholes or recompletions associated with the original wellbore. See 
							http://www.spwla.org/technical/api-technical for more information about API numbering.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: OtherID
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: OtherName
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Other human-intelligible labels for feature such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: BoreholeName
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Human-intelligible name by which the borehole identified by the HeaderURI is known. Convention for wellName is: Name = Operator + Well No. + Lease Owner. A well may consist of multiple boreholes (wellbores). If these are distinguished by different records in this table, they should have the same well names, but distinct BoreholeNames, and at least one identifier (APINo or OtherID) that is unique to the borehole. Conditional obligation - If the HeaderURI identifies a borehole which is one of several within a well, then a BoreholeName is mandatory. Each borehole should have a unique BoreholeName. Separate multiple BoreholeNames with the pipe character '|'.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Label
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: ParentWellURI
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: The unique identifier for the well that contains the wellbore identified by WellBoreURI.   If the WellBoreURI identifies one of several wellbores within a well, this element is mandatory. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the well.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: HeaderURI
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Unique identifier for the borehole indicated by this record. This identifier should identify the physical well, based on the API number if available. Otherwise, the URI should incorporate one of the OtherID values. Please contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: SpudDate
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Date on which drilling of the well bore began. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1' . If year is unknown, enter 1900. All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm. This is intended as a searching aid.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: EndedDrillingDate
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Date on which drilling of the well bore ended. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1' . If year is unknown, enter 1900. All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm. This is intended as a searching aid.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: DrillingMethod
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Basic drilling technology used in the creation of the borehole identified by the HeaderURI. Separate multiple drilling methods with the pipe  '|' character.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: WellType
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Type of well that contains the borehole identified by the HeaderURI, at the time indicated in the StatusDate element.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Status
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Status of the feature at the time indicated in the StatusDate element. If unknown enter "unknown" in the field.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: StatusDate
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: The status of the feature can change from time to time, thus it is useful to know the date on which a given status was reported. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: InterceptName
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Common or human-readable name by which the intercept is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Description
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Free text description of material at the intercept within the borehole. This is considered mandatory, the simplest and minimum amount of information necessary to define why this intercept is differentiated from other adjacent intercepts in the borehole. Also, any additional observations or other information regarding the feature, any special considerations with this instance (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: InterceptType
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: The intercept type within the borehole: Top or bottom.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: County
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: State
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: LocationName
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: LatDegree
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: LongDegree
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: SRS
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: InterceptDepth
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Depth to the top of the borehole intercept (contact) identified by the BHInterceptURI, from borehole origin to intercept.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: ElevationGL
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Elevation in feet at ground level at the well collar location. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: LengthUnits
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Units used to report all elevation and depth information.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: WellBoreShape
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Term used to indicate the overall shape of the borehole identified by the HeaderURI, e.g. vertical, inclined down, curved, horizontal, inclined up, unknown.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: TrueVerticalDepth
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Vertical distance from bottom hole point to elevation of borehole origin.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Permeability
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: The property or capacity of a porous rock, sediment, or soil for transmitting a fluid; it is a measure of the relative ease of fluid flow under unequal pressure.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: UnitsPermeability
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Units for the reported permability. The SI unit for permeability is m^2. A practical unit for permeability is the darcy (D), or more commonly the millidarcy (mD) (1 darcy \approx10−12/m^2).

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Porosity
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: The percentage of pore volume or void space, or that volume within rock that can contain fluids.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: UnitsPorosity
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Units of porosity are percent, reported as a decimal value.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Notes
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: ObservationMethod
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Report any information pertaining to measurements of the borehole interval, including porosity, permeability, geologic history or other tests performed and data reported. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: GeologicUnitName
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Name of geologic unit that was sampled. Include hierarchy of names if the unit is part of a higher-rank geologic unit, e.g. Group name/Formation name, or Formation/Member, or Group/ Formation. Spell out unit names in full.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: SpecificationURI
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: This URI could refer to a GeoSciML feature that describes the instance in detail.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Lithology
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Description of the lithology of surface geology or geologic column for well interval, e.g. arkose, granite, limestone, sandstone, schist. Recommend using CGI simple lithology vocabulary (see tab in this workbook). Use to account for EarthChem Material, EarthChem Type, EarthChem Composition, alluvium, 36-40': gravels; etc. Include a proportion value for each constituent.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: RepresentativeLithologyURI
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Unique identifier that specifies a category in a lithology generalization scheme. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: RelatedResource
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Source
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: MetadataURI
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

BoreholeLithIntercept.name: Shape
BoreholeLithIntercept.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.
