label: geosciml-portrayal-faults

status: Version 1.0 has been approved for use by the NGDS working group.
description: This template contains documents for information useful to characterize a subsurface reservoir for geothermal potential. The content model was created to provide a template for reservoir data gathered by the Texas BEG to be hosted by the NGDS, and has been revised to incorporate fields needed for Play Fairway Analysis projects. The intention is to provide a format that is clear and comprehensive so that it may be understood by fellow researchers in future studies. Also provide a standardized data template to allow for easy updating by multiple stakeholders and participants.
title: Geologic Reservoir

GeologicReservoir.name: OBJECTID
GeologicReservoir.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the WellHeaderTemplate.

GeologicReservoir.name: ReservoirURI
GeologicReservoir.description: Unique identifier that specifies the feature represented (geologic reservoir). Each geologic reservoir should have a unique identifier. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

GeologicReservoir.name: ReservoirName
GeologicReservoir.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature (Reservoir) is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

GeologicReservoir.name: Label
GeologicReservoir.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

GeologicReservoir.name: OtherID
GeologicReservoir.description: Alternative identifier(s) for site information. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

GeologicReservoir.name: OtherName
GeologicReservoir.description: Other human-intelligible labels for feature such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

GeologicReservoir.name: Description
GeologicReservoir.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

GeologicReservoir.name: County
GeologicReservoir.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

GeologicReservoir.name: State
GeologicReservoir.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

GeologicReservoir.name: LocationName
GeologicReservoir.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'.

GeologicReservoir.name: LatDegree
GeologicReservoir.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GeologicReservoir.name: LongDegree
GeologicReservoir.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GeologicReservoir.name: SRS
GeologicReservoir.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

GeologicReservoir.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
GeologicReservoir.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

GeologicReservoir.name: TemperatureMax_F
GeologicReservoir.description: Upper boundary of measured temperature range in reservoir, in decimal format.

GeologicReservoir.name: TemperatureMin_F
GeologicReservoir.description: Lower boundary of measured temperature range in reservoir, in decimal format.

GeologicReservoir.name: DepthToTop_ft
GeologicReservoir.description: Depth to top of reservoir.

GeologicReservoir.name: DepthToBottom_ft
GeologicReservoir.description: Depth to bottom of reservoir.

GeologicReservoir.name: DominantFormationName
GeologicReservoir.description: Name of geologic formation with the largest thickness in area of interest.

GeologicReservoir.name: OtherFormationName
GeologicReservoir.description: Other named geologic units that are of interest to the study; separate names with pipe ('|') character.

GeologicReservoir.name: DominantLithologyName
GeologicReservoir.description: Dominant rock type in reservoir. Use CGI lithology terms (see SimpleLithology2012 tab).

GeologicReservoir.name: OtherLithologyName
GeologicReservoir.description: Other rock types that are constituents of the reservoir; separate names with pipe ('|') character.

GeologicReservoir.name: Area_acres
GeologicReservoir.description: Area of reservoir extent. Description text for record should provide some indication of how this was estimated.

GeologicReservoir.name: Width_ft
GeologicReservoir.description: Maximum dimension of reservoir perpendicular to the length.

GeologicReservoir.name: Length_ft
GeologicReservoir.description: Maximum horizontal dimension of the reservoir.

GeologicReservoir.name: SandVolume_cft
GeologicReservoir.description: Volume of sand between specified isolines within data area.

GeologicReservoir.name: BlockVolume_cft
GeologicReservoir.description: Volume of sediment contained between specified isolines within data area.

GeologicReservoir.name: PercentSand
GeologicReservoir.description: Sand volume divided by block volume.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageNetSandThickness_ft
GeologicReservoir.description: Average net sand thickness across data area as calculated from well log interpretation.

GeologicReservoir.name: WellCount
GeologicReservoir.description: Number of wells contained by reservoir in question.

GeologicReservoir.name: FaultCount
GeologicReservoir.description: Number of faults contained by field in question.

GeologicReservoir.name: Faulted
GeologicReservoir.description: Indicate if the reservoir was bounded, or limited in size, by vertical faults. 'Yes' or 'No' may be appropriate indications.

GeologicReservoir.name: FaultType
GeologicReservoir.description: Indicate general type of fault: Growth, Normal, Thrust.

GeologicReservoir.name: FaultHydraulicCharacter
GeologicReservoir.description: Provide insight into whether there is fluid flow from greater depths along faults or if they are creating a trap/seal.

GeologicReservoir.name: FirstProductionDate
GeologicReservoir.description: Date for the record (of first production). Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GeologicReservoir.name: LastProductionDate
GeologicReservoir.description: Date for the record (of last production). Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GeologicReservoir.name: YearsInProduction
GeologicReservoir.description: Number of years of active production.

GeologicReservoir.name: MonthlyProduction_bbl
GeologicReservoir.description: Used to estimate current pressure and most recent production history across the field.

GeologicReservoir.name: ProductionReportDate
GeologicReservoir.description: Date for monthly production value. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageMonthlyWaterProduction_bbl
GeologicReservoir.description: Average monthly water production for every well in the field.

GeologicReservoir.name: MinimumMonthlyWaterProduction_bbl
GeologicReservoir.description: Minimum monthly water production from a well in the field.

GeologicReservoir.name: MaximumMonthlyWaterProduction_bbl
GeologicReservoir.description: Maximum monthly water production from a well in the field.

GeologicReservoir.name: WaterInjection_bbl
GeologicReservoir.description: Amount of water injected into a formation for disposal purposes or enhanced recovery.

GeologicReservoir.name: WaterSaturation_pct
GeologicReservoir.description: Water Saturation(%).

GeologicReservoir.name: WaterTDS_mgl
GeologicReservoir.description: Total Dissolved Solids. Milligrams per liter.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageFieldWidePressure_psi
GeologicReservoir.description: Corrected pressure, use standardized drawdown curve to approximate contemporary reservoir pressure values.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageFieldWideGradient_degfft
GeologicReservoir.description: Using corrected BHTs from wells in within the field. Degrees Fahrenheit per foot.

GeologicReservoir.name: PorosityMax_pct
GeologicReservoir.description: Maximum porosity values obtained from public data sources.

GeologicReservoir.name: PorosityMin_pct
GeologicReservoir.description: Minimum porosity values obtained from public data sources.

GeologicReservoir.name: PermeabilityMax_mD
GeologicReservoir.description: Maximum permeability based on Literature values for the field or calculated permeability using production tests. Units of millidarcies (mD).

GeologicReservoir.name: PermeabilityMin_mD
GeologicReservoir.description: Minimum permeability based on Literature values for the field or calculated permeability using production tests.Units of millidarcies (mD).

GeologicReservoir.name: CementationMineralogy
GeologicReservoir.description: Calcite, Quartz, Iron Oxides, Clay Minerals, etc.

GeologicReservoir.name: Trap
GeologicReservoir.description: Sealing formation or structural orientation to trap hydrocarbons.

GeologicReservoir.name: Drive
GeologicReservoir.description: Geopressure, dissolved gas drive, thermal expansion, etc.

GeologicReservoir.name: WaterDensity
GeologicReservoir.description: Indicate the water (or brine, likely) TDS (total dissolved solids). Unit of measure is mg/L.

GeologicReservoir.name: CommodityOfInterest
GeologicReservoir.description: The commodity of interest associated with the borehole.

GeologicReservoir.name: Stimulation
GeologicReservoir.description: A treatment performed to restore or enhance the productivity of a well.

GeologicReservoir.name: AveragePerforatedThickness_ft
GeologicReservoir.description: Average perforated thickness per well across field.

GeologicReservoir.name: RelatedResource
GeologicReservoir.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Separate multiple values with the pipe character '|'.

GeologicReservoir.name: Source
GeologicReservoir.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

GeologicReservoir.name: MetadataURI
GeologicReservoir.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

GeologicReservoir.name: Shape
GeologicReservoir.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

GeologicReservoir.name: OBJECTID
GeologicReservoir.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the WellHeaderTemplate.

GeologicReservoir.name: ReservoirURI
GeologicReservoir.description: Unique identifier that specifies the feature represented (geologic reservoir). Each geologic reservoir should have a unique identifier. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

GeologicReservoir.name: ReservoirName
GeologicReservoir.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature (Reservoir) is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.  In this context, "Reservoir" is understood to mean "a volume of rock from which heat can be extracted."

GeologicReservoir.name: Label
GeologicReservoir.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

GeologicReservoir.name: OtherID
GeologicReservoir.description: Alternative identifier(s) for site information. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

GeologicReservoir.name: OtherName
GeologicReservoir.description: Other human-intelligible labels for feature such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

GeologicReservoir.name: Description
GeologicReservoir.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

GeologicReservoir.name: County
GeologicReservoir.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

GeologicReservoir.name: State
GeologicReservoir.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

GeologicReservoir.name: LocationName
GeologicReservoir.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'.

GeologicReservoir.name: LatDegree
GeologicReservoir.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GeologicReservoir.name: LongDegree

GeologicReservoir.name: SRS
GeologicReservoir.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

GeologicReservoir.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
GeologicReservoir.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

GeologicReservoir.name: TemperatureMax_C
GeologicReservoir.description: Upper boundary of measured temperature range in reservoir, in decimal format.

GeologicReservoir.name: TemperatureMin_C
GeologicReservoir.description: Lower boundary of measured temperature range in reservoir, in decimal format.

GeologicReservoir.name: DepthToTop_m
GeologicReservoir.description: Depth to top of reservoir.

GeologicReservoir.name: DepthToBottom_m
GeologicReservoir.description: Depth to bottom of reservoir.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageReservoirDepth_m
GeologicReservoir.description: An average depth for the 'producing zone' of the reservoir.  For hydrocarbon reservoirs, this might be computed as a mean average of all total vertical depths (TVD) within the reservoir.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageReservoirDepthUncertainty
GeologicReservoir.description: An expression of the confidence in the  AverageReservoirDepth_m value.  Best practice to include units and assumptions for calculating uncertainty within AverageReservoirDepthMethodology.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageReservoirDepthMethodology
GeologicReservoir.description: The method for calculating AverageReservoirDepth_m is stated here.  Required if AverageReservoirDepth_m is provided.

GeologicReservoir.description: Formation of primary interest within the reservoir/fairway boundaries identified.

GeologicReservoir.description: Other named geologic units that are of interest to the study; separate names with pipe ('|') character.

GeologicReservoir.name: OtherLithologyName
GeologicReservoir.description: Other rock types that are constituents of the reservoir; separate names with pipe ('|') character.

GeologicReservoir.description: Describes the minimum value of the range for the Isolines. For example, if IsolineType is "isotherm", provide the minimum temperature.  Required if TargetRockVolume_m3 and BlockVolume_m3 are provided.

GeologicReservoir.description: Describes the maximum value of the range for the Isolines. For example, if IsolineType is "isotherm", provide the maximum temperature.  Required if TargetRockVolume_m3 and BlockVolume_m3 are provided.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageNetTargetRockThicknessMethodology
GeologicReservoir.description: The method for well log interpretation in calculating AverageNetTargetRockThickness_m is stated here.  Required if AverageNetTargetRockThickness_m is provided.

GeologicReservoir.description: Number of wells contained by reservoir in question.  Required if AverageWellDepth_m was provided.

If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GeologicReservoir.name: LastProductionDate
GeologicReservoir.description: Date for the record (of last production). Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GeologicReservoir.name: YearsInProduction
GeologicReservoir.description: Number of years of active production.

GeologicReservoir.name: MonthlyProduction_bbl
GeologicReservoir.description: Used to estimate current pressure and most recent production history across the field.

GeologicReservoir.name: ProductionReportDate
GeologicReservoir.description: Date for monthly production value. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GeologicReservoir.description: Total Dissolved Solids. Milligrams per liter.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageFieldWidePressure_MPa
GeologicReservoir.description: Corrected pressure, use standardized drawdown curve to approximate contemporary reservoir pressure values. In megapascals.

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageFieldWideGradient_degCm

GeologicReservoir.name: AverageSurfaceTemperature_degC

GeologicReservoir.description: Maximum porosity values obtained from public data sources.

GeologicReservoir.name: PorosityMin_pct

GeologicReservoir.name: PorosityAverage_pct
GeologicReservoir.description: The Average Porosity available from public data sources.  The method for calculating an average should be stated in PorosityAverageMethod.   Where only one porosity value is obtained from public data sources, the minimum, maximum, and average will be identical.

Examples of suitable parameters include flow rate, productivity, etc. Chosen parameter description and units need to be provided in methodology field.  Uncertainty and methodology are required if ReservoirFavorability is provided.

GeologicReservoir.description: The method for calculating ReservoirFavorability is stated here.  Required if ReservoirFavorability is provided, to explain units and calculation of ReservoirFavorability.  Also provide units and method for calculating ReservoirFavorabilityUncertainty. .

status: Version 2.0 has now been approved.
description: The GeologicUnitView Feature tab of this workbook indicates the content for Geologic Unit features. The entirety of the workbook is an information exchange workbook for GeoSciML-Portrayal, in which three features for WFS implementation are described (see alsohttp://schemas.usgin.org/models/#geosciml-portrayal-contacts and http://schemas.usgin.org/models/#geosciml-portrayal-faults). The model is based on the IUGS CGI interoperability working group. See https://www.seegrid.csiro.au/wiki/bin/view/CGIModel/GeoSciMLThematicView.... This schema is a view of GeoSciML data that denormalizes the data and concatenates complex property values into single, human-readable, labels and returns single, representative values from controlled vocabularies for multi-valued properties that can be used when generating thematic maps, or portrayals, of the data. It is separate to, but harmonized with, GeoSciML and conforms to the level 0 of the Simple Features Profile for GML (link). Labels will be 'free-text' fields that will be, in robust services, well-structured summaries of complex GeoSciML data, while the representative thematic properties will be URIs of concepts in a controlled vocabulary. There may also be links, via identifier URIs, to full GeoSciML representations of the geologic features. The geologic unit feature content also conforms closely to the content in the USGS-AASG NCGMP09 database design for a description of map units. These features are essentially geographically located descriptions of outcrop to map scale units of rock--including lithologic composition, age, internal structure (bedding, foliation etc.) and genesis. The content model might be associated with map units on a geologic map, individual polygons (on a map) or borehole intervals (in a stratigraphic log), or with point locations to describe outcrops in field data. For descriptions associated with maps or polygons (outcrop areas), location uncertainty properties are not included.
title: Geologic Units

ContactView.name: identifier
ContactView.description: Globally unique identifer. Should have the same value as the corresponding GeoSciML MappedFeature.

ContactView.name: name
ContactView.description: Display name for the the Contact.

ContactView.name: description
ContactView.description: Text description of the Contact, typically taken from an entry on a geological map legend.

ContactView.name: contactType
ContactView.description: Type of Contact (as defined in GeoSciML).

ContactView.name: observationMethod
ContactView.description: Metadata snippet indicating how the spatial extent of the feature was determined. ObservationMethod is a convenience property that provides a quick and dirty approach to observation metadata when data are reported using a feature view (as opposed to observation view).

ContactView.name: positionalAccuracy
ContactView.description: Quantitative values define the radius of an uncertainty buffer around a mappedFeature (eg: a positionAccuracy of 100 m for a line feature defines a buffer polygon of total width 200 m centred on the line).

ContactView.name: source
ContactView.description: Text describing feature-specific details and citations to source materials, and if available providing URLs to reference material and publications describing the geologic feature. This could be a short text synopsis of key inforamtion that would also be in the metadata record referenced by metadata_uri.

ContactView.name: contactType_uri
ContactView.description: URI referring to a controlled concept from a vocabulary defining the Contact types. Mandatory propery - if not value is provided then a URI referring to a conctrolled concept explaining why the value is nil must be provided.

ContactView.name: specification_uri
ContactView.description: URI referring the the GeoSciML Contact feature that describes the instance in detail. Mandatory propery - if not value is provided then a URI referring to a conctrolled concept explaining why the value is nil must be provided.

ContactView.name: metadata_uri
ContactView.description: URI referring to a metadata record describing the provenance of data.

ContactView.name: genericSymbolizer
ContactView.description: Identifier for a symbol from standard (locally or community defined) symbolization scheme for portrayal.

ContactView.name: shape
ContactView.description: Geometry defining the extent of the feature of interest.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: identifier
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Globally unique identifer. Should have the same value as the corresponding GeoSciML MappedFeature.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: name
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Display name for the the ShearDisplacementStructure.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: description
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Text description of the ShearDisplacementStructure, typically taken from an entry on a geological map legend.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: faultType
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Type of ShearDisplacementStructure (as defined in GeoSciML).

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: movementType
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Summarises the type of movement (eg dip-slip, strike-slip) on the ShearDisplacementStructure.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: deformationStyle
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Describes the style of deformation (eg brittle,ductile etc) for the ShearDisplacementStructure.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: displacement
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Summarises the displacement across the ShearDisplacementStructure.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: geologicHistory
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Text (possibly formatted with formal syntax) description of the age of the ShearDisplacementStructure (where age is a sequence of events and may include process and environment information).

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: observationMethod
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Metadata snippet indicating how the spatial extent of the feature was determined. ObservationMethod is a convenience property that provides a quick and dirty approach to observation metadata when data are reported using a feature view (as opposed to observation view).

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: positionalAccuracy
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Quantitative values define the radius of an uncertainty buffer around a mappedFeature (eg: a positionAccuracy of 100 m for a line feature defines a buffer polygon of total width 200 m centred on the line).

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: source
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Text describing feature-specific details and citations to source materials, and if available providing URLs to reference material and publications describing the geologic feature. This could be a short text synopsis of key inforamtion that would also be in the metadata record referenced by metadata_uri.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: faultType_uri
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: URI referring to a controlled concept from a vocabulary defining the fault (ShearDisplacementStructure) type. Mandatory propery - if not value is provided then a URI referring to a conctrolled concept explaining why the value is nil must be provided.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: movementType_uri
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: URI referring to a controlled concept from a vocabulary defining the ShearDisplacementStructure movement type. Mandatory propery - if not value is provided then a URI referring to a conctrolled concept explaining why the value is nil must be provided.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: deformationStyle_uri
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: URI referring to a controlled concept from a vocabulary defining the ShearDisplacementStructure deformation style. Mandatory propery - if not value is provided then a URI referring to a conctrolled concept explaining why the value is nil must be provided.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: representativeAge_uri
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: URI referring to a controlled concept specifying the most representative stratigraphic age interval for the GeologicUnit. This will be defined entirely at the discretion of the data provider and may be a single event selected from the geologic feature's geological history or a value summarising the all or part of the feature's history.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: representativeOlderAge_uri
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: URI referring to a controlled concept specifying the most representative older value in a range of stratigraphic age intervals for the GeologicUnit. This will be defined entirely at the discretion of the data provider and  may be a single event selected from the geologic feature's geological history or a value summarising the all or part of the feature's history.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: representativeYoungerAge_uri
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: URI referring to a controlled concept specifying the most representative younger value in a range of stratigraphic age intervals for the GeologicUnit. This will be defined entirely at the discretion of the data provider and  may be a single event selected from the geologic feature's geological history or a value summarising the all or part of the feature's history.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: specification_uri
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: URI referring the the GeoSciML ShearDisplacementStructure feature that describes the instance in detail. Mandatory propery - if not value is provided then a URI referring to a conctrolled concept explaining why the value is nil must be provided.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: metadata_uri
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: URI referring to a metadata record describing the provenance of data.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: genericSymbolizer
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Identifier for a symbol from standard (locally or community defined) symbolization scheme for portrayal.

ShearDisplacementStructureView.name: shape
ShearDisplacementStructureView.description: Geometry defining the extent of the feature of interest.

GeologicUnitView.name: name

GeologicUnitView.name: rank

GeologicUnitView.name: lithology

GeologicUnitView.name: geologicHistory
GeologicUnitView.description: Text (possibly formatted with formal syntax) description of the age of the GeologicUnit (where age is a sequence of events and may include process and environment information).

GeologicUnitView.name: observationMethod

GeologicUnitView.name: geologicUnitType_uri

status:
Version 0.5 Schema

All currently deployed services currently use the 0.5 schema, and this schema is recommended for current use.

Version 0.7 has been submitted for NGDS technical team review, and the Excel workbook has been adopted for NGDS partner projects and posted on the NGDS web site resources/public documents section.
description:
This package contains both an Excel spreadsheet and an accompanying personal geodatabase (PGD) for data delivery of a Geothermal Area dataset (polygons). Design is focused on providing characteristics of sites identified as having geothermal potential. Geothermal area content for the state geothermal data system is intended as a tool to identify areas that may be associated with geothermal resource potential. Thus, the content model does not include specific measurements/data collection information that would be important for analysis; such information should be accessed by querying other related data sets in the area of interest such as borehole temperature observation services, thermal conductivity services, and published reports.

The deliverable is the personal geodatabase containing the geometry information.
title: Geothermal Area
discussion: This template defines the content model for a service that delivers geothermal area polygon features. These data will have general information about land ownership, temperature characterization, geologic setting and information source. The Geothermal Area template is designed to be used for data compilation from maps and field data. The content model presented here is intended to present key information necessary to query a geothermal areas service and to evaluate/investigate geothermal potential.

GeothermalArea.name: OBJECTID
GeothermalArea.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

GeothermalArea.name: GeothermalAreaURI
GeothermalArea.description: Unique identifier that specifies the feature (Geothermal Area). Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

GeothermalArea.name: FieldName
GeothermalArea.description: Name of the Geothermal Area. If multiple names are or have been used for the field, separate values with a '|' character.

GeothermalArea.name: OtherLocationName
GeothermalArea.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'.

GeothermalArea.name: Notes
GeothermalArea.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

GeothermalArea.name: ResourceType
GeothermalArea.description: List the type of resource present in the geothermal field.

GeothermalArea.name: GeologicSetting
GeothermalArea.description: Description of the geologic setting where the resource occurs.

GeothermalArea.name: GeothermTempCharacterization
GeothermalArea.description: Simple characterization of the geothermal resource. Use terms "High Temperature" or "Low Temperature".

GeothermalArea.name: LandOwner
GeothermalArea.description: Companies, individuals, or other entities who own the property. Separate multiple with a pipe '|' character.

GeothermalArea.name: County
GeothermalArea.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

GeothermalArea.name: State
GeothermalArea.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

GeothermalArea.name: LatCentroid
GeothermalArea.description: Latitude coordinate of Centroid of polygon defining geothermal area; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GeothermalArea.name: LongCentroid
GeothermalArea.description: Longitude coordinate of Centroid of polygon defining geothermal area; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GeothermalArea.name: SRS
GeothermalArea.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

GeothermalArea.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
GeothermalArea.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

GeothermalArea.name: MeanReservoirTemp
GeothermalArea.description: Average temperature of the reservoir fluids, in decimal format. Degrees Celsius is preferred and will be reported for consistency in service implementation.

GeothermalArea.name: TemperatureUnits
GeothermalArea.description: Reporting units are either Celsius (preferred) or Fahrenheit. Use same units throughout this document.

GeothermalArea.name: EstimatedReservoirVolume
GeothermalArea.description: Report in km3 (cubic kilometers).

GeothermalArea.name: MeanCapacity
GeothermalArea.description: Report in MW (megawatts) units.

GeothermalArea.name: GrossProductionCapacity
GeothermalArea.description: Total energy production possible, reported in MW units.

GeothermalArea.name: NetProductionCapacity
GeothermalArea.description: Total energy production possible less other production variables, reported in MW units.

GeothermalArea.name: NumberOperatingPlants
GeothermalArea.description: Number of operating plants in the defined geothermal area.

GeothermalArea.name: Owners
GeothermalArea.description: Companies, individuals, or other entities who own the property. Separate multiple with a pipe '|' character.

GeothermalArea.name: PowerPurchasers
GeothermalArea.description: List of those who purchase power from the facilities in the given geothermal area. Separate multiple values with a pipe character '|'.

GeothermalArea.name: NumberProductionWells
GeothermalArea.description: The total number of production wells for all facilities within the given geothermal area.

GeothermalArea.name: NumberInjectionWells
GeothermalArea.description: The total number of the injection wells for all facilities within the given geothermal area.

GeothermalArea.name: AverageTemperatureGeofluid
GeothermalArea.description: Average temperature of the fluids in the geothermal field. Use the same units as defined in TemperatureUnits field.

GeothermalArea.name: AverageDepthReservoir
GeothermalArea.description: The average depth to the reservoir, given in units of km (kilometers).

GeothermalArea.name: DevelopmentArea
GeothermalArea.description: Report in km^2 (square kilometers).

GeothermalArea.name: RelatedResource
GeothermalArea.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

GeothermalArea.name: Source
GeothermalArea.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

GeothermalArea.name: MetadataURI
GeothermalArea.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

GeothermalArea.name: Shape
GeothermalArea.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: geothermalarea

status: No Services currently deployed using this content model.
description:
**PLEASE NOTE:**

This content model has been superseded by Well Fluid Production content model. Please use that or the Fluid Flux Injection Disposal content models for future fluid production data. 

This workbook documents a content model for exchange of information about fluid fluxes into or out of a geothermal well. A generic model is intended to allow for oil, gas, or water fluid transfer. Oil and gas facilities may include off-shore platforms, whereas water facilities may include geothermal power plants. Because of the wide variety of possible flow measurements (commodities, aggregation type), the model adopts a thin approach, which may result in many records being returned for a single well. Thus most data about the well is linked through the HeaderURI instead of included inline to keep the redundant data volume down.
title: Geothermal Fluid Production (deprecated)
discussion: This template defines the content model for a service that delivers geothermal fluid production observations. Many of these will be a standard map location and production volume, but other information may be delivered. The geothermal fluid production content model is designed to be used for data compilation from publications, reports, and databases. This content model is intended to present key information necessary to query a geothermal fluid production observation service and to evaluate the reported data.
label: geothermalfluidproduction

description:
This template is for use in compiling metadata content in a structured tabular format that can be automatically transformed into any of several metadata encoding and content schemes.  The content is based on the USGIN Recommended Metadata Model  The goal of this template is to make metadata creation easier while still complying to metadata requirements for the:
  • National Geothermal Data System (NGDS) project
  • OGC Catalog Service for the Web (CSW) protocol
  • ISO 19139 (international geospatial metadata) standard
  • FGDC CSDGM (federal geospatial metadata) standard



See also:

USGIN content recommendations for geoscience information resources.

USGIN full ISO 19139 metadata profile (ISO 19115 and ISO 19119).
title: Geothermal Metadata Compilation
discussion: This spreadsheet is somewhat different from other templates in that the column names in the spreadsheet are not precisely the same as xml elements in the interchange document used to transport the metadata content. Metadata is being encoding for the NGDS using ISO19139 xml encoding of ISO 19115 content. This is a complex XML schema that can not be fully represented in the flat table format offered by a spreadsheet. Column names in the spreadsheet correspond to element names in the XML loosely.
label: Metadata

status: Services are currently deployed using the 0.2 version.
description: This information exchange indicates content requested for features representing Geothermal Power Plant locations. Design is focused on power plants portrayed as geospatial points with an associated plant type, capacity in megawatts, and use application. Power plant data for the geothermal data system is intended as a tool to identify sites with existing power plants. Thus, the content model may not include detailed information that would be important for determining geothermal potential; such information should be accessed by including related resource links. As such, data should be restricted to records for existing facilities.
title: Geothermal Power Plant Facility
discussion: This template defines the content model for a service that delivers Geothermal Power plant features. Many of these will be standard map location and IDs, but other information may be delivered. The geothermal power plant content model is designed to be used for data compilation from reports, maps, and databases. The content model presented here is intended to present key information necessary to query a power plant feature service and to evaluate the information. Service name will be PowerPlantFacilities, with layer name indicated as PowerPlantFacility.

PowerPlantFacility.name: OBJECTID
PowerPlantFacility.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

PowerPlantFacility.name: FacilityURI
PowerPlantFacility.description: Unique identifier that specifies the feature represented: e.g. a geologic feature, aquifer or facility structure. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

PowerPlantFacility.name: PlantName
PowerPlantFacility.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature  is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

PowerPlantFacility.name: PlantType
PowerPlantFacility.description: Dry Steam; Flash Steam; Binary Cycle; Single Flash; Double Flash. If Unknown or missing place "nil:missing" or "nil:unknown"

PowerPlantFacility.name: OtherID
PowerPlantFacility.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. 'Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Label
PowerPlantFacility.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Owner
PowerPlantFacility.description: Companies, individuals, or other entities who own the property. Separate multiple with a pipe '|' character.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Operator
PowerPlantFacility.description: Companies, individuals, or other entities who operate the property. Separate multiple with a pipe '|' character.

PowerPlantFacility.name: OperationalDate
PowerPlantFacility.description: Date for the record (year in which the first power plant at the site began operation). Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Status
PowerPlantFacility.description: Status of the feature at the time indicated in the StatusDate element. If unknown enter "unknown" in the field.

PowerPlantFacility.name: StatusDate
PowerPlantFacility.description: The status of the feature can change from time to time, thus it is useful to know the date on which a given status was reported. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

PowerPlantFacility.name: PLSS_Meridians
PowerPlantFacility.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Township
PowerPlantFacility.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001 N.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Range
PowerPlantFacility.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Section_
PowerPlantFacility.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

PowerPlantFacility.name: SectionPart
PowerPlantFacility.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

PowerPlantFacility.name: UTM_E
PowerPlantFacility.description: UTM easting coordinate as decimal number.

PowerPlantFacility.name: UTM_N
PowerPlantFacility.description: UTM northing coordinate as decimal number.

PowerPlantFacility.name: UTMDatumZone
PowerPlantFacility.description: The datum and UTM zone for the reported coordinates. Datum for most locations should be NAD27 or NAD83.

PowerPlantFacility.name: County
PowerPlantFacility.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

PowerPlantFacility.name: State
PowerPlantFacility.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

PowerPlantFacility.name: LatDegree
PowerPlantFacility.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

PowerPlantFacility.name: LongDegree
PowerPlantFacility.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

PowerPlantFacility.name: SRS
PowerPlantFacility.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

PowerPlantFacility.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
PowerPlantFacility.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

PowerPlantFacility.name: LocationUncertaintyCode
PowerPlantFacility.description: A controlled vocabulary term or code value specifying the location confidence, E.g. 1 = reported, 2= surveyed, 3= GPS. If such a code list or vocabulary is used, it must be added to the 'Data Valid Terms' sheet to enumerate the possible values and their meaning.

PowerPlantFacility.name: LocationUncertaintyRadius
PowerPlantFacility.description: Radius (in meters) of circle of confidence for location. Ideally might represent some specific confidence criteria like 'radius of circle around reported location which which true location lies with 95% confidence', but such precision is rarely available.

PowerPlantFacility.name: LocationKeyword
PowerPlantFacility.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Notes
PowerPlantFacility.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

PowerPlantFacility.name: UseApplication
PowerPlantFacility.description: Statement for how heat is being used. Should come from controlled vocabulary.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Capacity_MW
PowerPlantFacility.description: Production capacity of the power plant in MW. Included as a search parameter.

PowerPlantFacility.name: FacilityContact
PowerPlantFacility.description: Person, organization, or position name for information about the facility.

PowerPlantFacility.name: PostalAddress
PowerPlantFacility.description: Postal address for facility. Street, City, State.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Zip
PowerPlantFacility.description: Zip code for facility; may be used for some geolocation information.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Phone
PowerPlantFacility.description: Telephone number to contact party connected with facility.

PowerPlantFacility.name: EMailAddress
PowerPlantFacility.description: E-mail address to contact party connected with facility.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Source
PowerPlantFacility.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

PowerPlantFacility.name: FluidTemperature_C
PowerPlantFacility.description: Water temperature, in decimal format. Degrees Celsius is preferred and will be reported for consistency in service implementations.

PowerPlantFacility.name: Flow_gpm
PowerPlantFacility.description: Fluid production flow rate.

PowerPlantFacility.name: RelatedResource
PowerPlantFacility.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

PowerPlantFacility.name: MetadataURI
PowerPlantFacility.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

PowerPlantFacility.name: UpdateTimeStamp
PowerPlantFacility.description: Date of last time line of data was updated or corrected by the service provider.(Format: 2012-06-22T00:00).

PowerPlantFacility.name: Shape
PowerPlantFacility.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: PowerPlantFacility

status: Version 0.1 has been approved for use by the NGDS working group.
description: This information exchange defines data model for observations of the acceleration of gravity. Fields in the content model will become XML elements in interchange documents for WFS simple feature in the USGIN system.
title: Gravity Stations

GravityStation.name: OBJECTID
GravityStation.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

GravityStation.name: ObservationURI
GravityStation.description: Unique identifier for this observation. This is the identifier (Uniform Resource Identifier) that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

GravityStation.name: ObservationLabel
GravityStation.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

GravityStation.name: Notes
GravityStation.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

GravityStation.name: StationName
GravityStation.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset. The station plays the role of 'sampling feature' for the gravity observation.

GravityStation.name: StationIdentifier
GravityStation.description: Unique identifier for the station at which the observation was made.

GravityStation.name: OtherID
GravityStation.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. 'Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix for 1337 would be azgs:, and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

GravityStation.name: County
GravityStation.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

GravityStation.name: State
GravityStation.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

GravityStation.name: LatDegree
GravityStation.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GravityStation.name: LongDegree
GravityStation.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GravityStation.name: SRS
GravityStation.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

GravityStation.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
GravityStation.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

GravityStation.name: Elevation_m
GravityStation.description: Elevation, in meters, at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

GravityStation.name: VerticalDatum
GravityStation.description: The point of reference against which elevation measurements are made. Best practice: use mean sea level (MSL) as datum.

GravityStation.name: ObservationDate
GravityStation.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GravityStation.name: ObservedGravity_mgal
GravityStation.description: Value of acceleration of gravity as measured using the instrument and procedure described in the Procedure element.

GravityStation.name: CompleteBouguerValue_mgal
GravityStation.description: Observed gravity measurement with Latitude, FreeAir, Bouguer, and Terrain corrections applied. 4 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6).

GravityStation.name: LatitudeCorrection_mgal
GravityStation.description: The gravity measurement with a latitude correction applied (see Keller, 2007; http://www.geophysik.uni-muenchen.de/~jowa/praktikum09/gravity_data.pdf, page 6). 4 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6).

GravityStation.name: FreeAirCorrection_mgal
GravityStation.description: Correction for variation in observed gravity based on elevation of station; Newton’s law of gravitation predicts that gravity varies with distance from the center of the Earth. 4 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6).

GravityStation.name: BouguerCorrection_mgal
GravityStation.description: Correction for variation of gravity with elevation due to the mass of the material between the gravity station and the vertical datum. 4 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6).

GravityStation.name: TerrainCorrection_mgal
GravityStation.description: Correction for effects of nearby topography. Hills and valleys attract the mass in the gravimeter (valleys are considered to have negative density with respect to the surrounding rocks) and reduces the observed value of gravity. This correction is always positive (a hill pulls up on the mass in the gravimeter and a valley is a mass deficiency). 4 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6).

GravityStation.name: IsostaticCorrection_mgal
GravityStation.description: Correction to account for the gravitational effects of the masses that compensate topography and remove them from the Free Air or Bouguer anomaly values.

GravityStation.name: Uncertainty_mgal
GravityStation.description: Data contributors should include an estimated accuracy for their data (USGS OFR 02-463, p.6). 4 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6).

GravityStation.name: ObservationMethod
GravityStation.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

GravityStation.name: Instrument
GravityStation.description: Name of the instrument used to make the observation.

GravityStation.name: Observer
GravityStation.description: Name of the individual who made the observation.

GravityStation.name: BaseStation
GravityStation.description: Name of base station used as calibration for measurement.

GravityStation.name: RelatedResource
GravityStation.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Separate multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

GravityStation.name: MetadataURI
GravityStation.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

GravityStation.name: Source
GravityStation.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

GravityStation.name: Shape
GravityStation.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: gravitystations

status: The latest version of the content model (v1.23) has been adopted by the NGDS technical team review. Please use this version for future services, which will require differentiating the version in the service name. When deploying with ArcMap products, the newest version does not allow "." in names of web services, so the use of "_" has been implemented as such:  AZHeatFlow1_23               Please use this naming convention for future Heat Flow services. For use in GeoServer, please see the app-schema mapping file 'HeatFlow.xml' at http://repository.stategeothermaldata.org/resources/documents/App-Schema-Mapping-Files/hf/azheatflow/   SLDs (Styled Layer Descriptors) can be downloaded from http://repository.stategeothermaldata.org/metadata/record/50ec3aefb656b70647f32e38bc1b7479/file/ngdsstyledlayerdescriptors.zip
description:
This spreadsheet indicates the content requested for observation features representing Heat Flow measurements. The content model is based on specifications gathered from the SMU Heat Flow database, and has been extended to include the specifics of Heat Flow data from other parties.

Minimal required features include Observation URI, Well Name, Header URI, Label, County, State, Latitude and Longitude Degrees, Source, Driller Depth, Interval, Thermal Conductivity, Gradient, Heat Flow, and Heat Flow Method.
title: Heat Flow
discussion: Note that thermal gradient observations based on two (or more) temperature measurements in a borehole that are not converted to heat flow measurements for whatever reason (thermal conductivity uncertainty...) should be reported as multiple BoreholeTemperature Observation features.

HeatFlow.name: OBJECTID
HeatFlow.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

HeatFlow.name: ObservationURI
HeatFlow.description: Unique identifier for this observation. This is the identifier (Uniform Resource Identifier) that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

HeatFlow.name: ObservationName
HeatFlow.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

HeatFlow.name: Label
HeatFlow.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

HeatFlow.name: HeatFlowType
HeatFlow.description: Valid terms are SiteHF or IntervalHF Site = 'best' or 'highest confidence' value for the location. Interval = a unique combination of temperature, thermal conductivity, and heatflow for a location. If there is only one set of data (a single observation) for a location, use 'Site' in this field. If subsequent values become become available for a given location, the 'Site' value must be updated accordingly.

HeatFlow.name: RelatedHeatFlowIntervalsURI
HeatFlow.description: If Heat Flow value is based on multiple intervals, observationURIs are listed here. Unique identifier for this observation. This is the identifier (Uniform Resource Identifier) that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

HeatFlow.name: HeaderURI
HeatFlow.description: Unique identifier for the borehole indicated by this record. This identifier should identify the physical well, based on the API number if available. Otherwise, the URI should incorporate one of the OtherID values. Please contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

HeatFlow.name: APINo
HeatFlow.description: API number for the the wellbore/borehole identified by the HeaderURI. If an API number is unavailable this field is empty. Usage of hyphens is optional, according to standard practice in each state. API number refers to the American Petroleum Institute number. Each oil, gas, or geothermal well drilled in the United States has a unique API number; this number identifies all boreholes or recompletions associated with the original wellbore. See the Data Valid Terms tab or http://www.spwla.org/technical/api-technical for more information about API numbering.

HeatFlow.name: WellName
HeatFlow.description: Human-intelligible name by which the feature  is known. Convention for wellName is: Name = Operator + Well No. + Lease Owner. A well may consist of multiple boreholes (wellbores). If these are distinguished by different records in this table, they should have the same well names, but distinct BoreholeNames, and at least one identifier (APINo or OtherID) that is unique to the borehole.

HeatFlow.name: OtherID
HeatFlow.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. 'Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

HeatFlow.name: Owner
HeatFlow.description: Companies, individuals, or other entities who own the property. Separate multiple with a pipe '|' character.

HeatFlow.name: LeaseName
HeatFlow.description: Name of lease; usually incorporates property owner.

HeatFlow.name: Field
HeatFlow.description: Name of the field in which the borehole is located. If multiple names are or have been used for the field, separate values with a pipe '|' character.

HeatFlow.name: County
HeatFlow.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

HeatFlow.name: State
HeatFlow.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

HeatFlow.name: LatDegreeWGS84
HeatFlow.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature using WGS1984; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

HeatFlow.name: LongDegreeWGS84
HeatFlow.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature using WGS1984; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

HeatFlow.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
HeatFlow.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

HeatFlow.name: PLSS_Meridians
HeatFlow.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

HeatFlow.name: Township
HeatFlow.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

HeatFlow.name: Range
HeatFlow.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

HeatFlow.name: Section_
HeatFlow.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

HeatFlow.name: SectionPart
HeatFlow.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

HeatFlow.name: TectonicProvince
HeatFlow.description: Tectonic division of a region based on geology.

HeatFlow.name: OtherLocationName
HeatFlow.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, separate these identifiers with the pipe character '|'.

HeatFlow.name: PublicationSource
HeatFlow.description: Most recent source of the Heat Flow Value, e.g., journal, book, report, internet site, etc. Consists of 2 parts: Primary Author's last name, Year Published; if available include the Publication Unique ID. If unpublished, include owner/location of data (e.g., unpublished SMU 2011).

HeatFlow.name: AdditionalSources
HeatFlow.description: For more than one publication, list older references here. List data sources for other parameters, e. g., conductivity, climate data, surface temperature, cross-sections, etc; text description of observation lineage / provenance.

HeatFlow.name: RelatedResource
HeatFlow.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

HeatFlow.name: WellType
HeatFlow.description: Type of well that contains the borehole.

HeatFlow.name: WellDrillDate
HeatFlow.description: Date of well activity entered in WellDrillDateType field. Specify day, month and year; Will be displayed using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,').All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm.

HeatFlow.name: WellDrillDateType
HeatFlow.description: Provide what the 'drill date' represents. e.g. Spud/Start, Completion, Well Header date, etc.

HeatFlow.name: Elevation
HeatFlow.description: Elevation of the well. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

HeatFlow.name: ElevationType
HeatFlow.description: Specify where value in elevation field refers to. Valid terms include: GL-Ground level, KB - Kelly bushing, DF - Derrick floor, well collar, other, unknown.

HeatFlow.name: DepthUnits
HeatFlow.description: Units used to report all elevation and depth information.

HeatFlow.name: DrillerTotalDepth
HeatFlow.description: Length of borehole identified by the HeaderURI, from borehole origin to bottom of borehole.

HeatFlow.name: TimeSinceCirculation
HeatFlow.description: The amount of time since circulation in well stopped before temperature was taken. Stated on Well Log Header.

HeatFlow.name: TemperatureUnits
