status: This content model is currently in review by the GDSDPWG working group, and as such no XML schema currently exists for this content model.
description: This workbook documents a content model for basic data characterizing a physical sample. The content model is based on consideration of content requested for SESAR, EarthTime, GeoSciML, Storet, ISO19115.  Focus is on terrestrial (land based) samples. Content model includes sufficient information for SESAR registration (see http://www.geosamples.org/), but is not complete with all possible content in the SESAR sample data model.
title: Physical Sample

PhysicalSample.name: OBJECTID
PhysicalSample.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

PhysicalSample.name: SpecimenURI
PhysicalSample.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

PhysicalSample.name: SpecimenLabel
PhysicalSample.description: Short text string to identify/characterize the samples used in this observation; may include one or more sample names as provided by the sample collector or analyzing laboratory.

PhysicalSample.name: SpecimenDescription
PhysicalSample.description: Free text description of sample, including size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc.

PhysicalSample.name: ParentSpecimenURI
PhysicalSample.description: Identifier for a specimen from which this specimen was sub-sampled; e.g. if a piece from a registered core is registered as a separate sample, this would be the identifier for the core.

PhysicalSample.name: OtherID
PhysicalSample.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

PhysicalSample.name: GeologicUnitName
PhysicalSample.description: Name of geologic unit that was sampled. Include hierarchy of names if the unit is part of a higher-rank geologic unit, e.g. Group name/Formation name, or Formation/Member, or Group/ Formation. Spell out unit names in full.

PhysicalSample.name: FeatureOfInterestURI
PhysicalSample.description: Unique identifier that specifies the feature represented: e.g. a geologic feature, aquifer or facility structure. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

PhysicalSample.name: SamplingFeatureName
PhysicalSample.description: Human-intelligible name of sample location, e.g.  well, outcrop, 'Exxon 1 Cochise well', 'Outcrop on Hwy 63 mile marker 125' etc. from which the specimen was obtained. If missing, use OGC nil value (see OGC_nilValues tab).

PhysicalSample.name: SamplingFeatureURI
PhysicalSample.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

PhysicalSample.name: MaterialClass
PhysicalSample.description: Category from simple material classification scheme e.g. rock, sediment, aqueous liquid, other liquid, gas, biological material.

PhysicalSample.name: LithologyTerms
PhysicalSample.description: Description of the lithology of surface geology or geologic column for well interval, e.g. granite, sandstone, limestone, arkose, schist. Recommend using CGI simple lithology vocabulary. Use to account for EarthChem Material, EarthChem Type, EarthChem Composition, alluvium, 36-40': gravels; etc.

PhysicalSample.name: RockName
PhysicalSample.description: Free text name for lithology category of sample, e.g. biotite-hornblende granite, lithofeldspathic sandstone, calcareous arkose, biotite schist.

PhysicalSample.name: SpecimenCollector
PhysicalSample.description: Free text specification of person, organization, affiliation, address, etc. for party that originally collected specimen. Include contact information if available.

PhysicalSample.name: SpecimenCollectorURI
PhysicalSample.description: Unique identifier for party that originally collected specimen. Ideally an http URI that will dereference to some standard representation like CI_ResponsibleParty (ISO19115).

PhysicalSample.name: DateCollected
PhysicalSample.description: Date for the record (date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

PhysicalSample.name: CollectionMethod
PhysicalSample.description: Coring, blasting, dredging, etc.

PhysicalSample.name: CollectionPurpose
PhysicalSample.description: Analysis, sample collection, etc.

PhysicalSample.name: SpecimenType
PhysicalSample.description: TTerm to describe the type of specimen. Use term from list of Specimen types. If the specimen type collected is not present on this list, add the specimen type to the list in the example column.

PhysicalSample.name: SpecimenMass_kg
PhysicalSample.description: Measured or best estimate of mass of sample; report in kilograms for interoperability.

PhysicalSample.name: CurrentCurationLocation
PhysicalSample.description: Free text Name of institutiion, museum, or repository where the sample is currently stored.

PhysicalSample.name: SpecimenCuration
PhysicalSample.description: Other information about specimen curation-previous history of curation; contact information for person who should be contacted for information about or access to the sample.

PhysicalSample.name: CuratorURI
PhysicalSample.description: Identifier for the party that currently has stewardship of the specimen. Ideally an http URI that will dereference to a standard CI_ResponsibleParty type representation of the party.

PhysicalSample.name: AccessConstraint
PhysicalSample.description: Text specification of constraints on access to this sample description. Might include a date when information becomes public, and term like: public, private, sandbox, for use by sample catalog system.

PhysicalSample.name: County
PhysicalSample.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

PhysicalSample.name: State
PhysicalSample.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

PhysicalSample.name: LocationKeyword
PhysicalSample.description: Additional information or more geographic names associated with sample collection location; if multiple names supplied, delimit with pipe '|' character, e.g. Arizona | La Paz County | Harquahala Mountains | Browns Canyon.

PhysicalSample.name: PLSS_Meridians
PhysicalSample.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

PhysicalSample.name: TWP
PhysicalSample.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

PhysicalSample.name: RGE
PhysicalSample.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

PhysicalSample.name: Section_
PhysicalSample.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

PhysicalSample.name: SectionPart
PhysicalSample.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

PhysicalSample.name: Parcel
PhysicalSample.description: Legal parcel identifier, block number or other parcel or location identifier.

PhysicalSample.name: UTM_E
PhysicalSample.description: UTM easting coordinate as decimal number.

PhysicalSample.name: UTM_N
PhysicalSample.description: UTM northing coordinate as decimal number.

PhysicalSample.name: UTMZone
PhysicalSample.description: The datum and UTM zone for the reported coordinates. Datum for most locations should be NAD27 or NAD83.

PhysicalSample.name: LatDegree
PhysicalSample.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

PhysicalSample.name: LongDegree
PhysicalSample.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

PhysicalSample.name: SRS
PhysicalSample.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

PhysicalSample.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
PhysicalSample.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

PhysicalSample.name: LocationDescription
PhysicalSample.description: Free text description of the sample location, the specific place where your sample was collected, method used to determine the location of the sample, e.g. GPS, DVL, or relation to parent sample.

PhysicalSample.name: VerticalExtentMax_m
PhysicalSample.description: Maximum elevation at which a sample was collected [in meters]. Use negative values for depth below sea level. Minimum elevation if a range is provided for the elevation/depth below sea level. “678.5”; “-4536” (=4536 meters depth below sea level).

PhysicalSample.name: VerticalExtentMin_m
PhysicalSample.description: Minimum elevation at which a sample was collected [in meters]. Use negative values for depth below sea level. Minimum elevation if a range is provided for the elevation/depth below sea level. “678.5”; “-4536” (=4536 meters depth below sea level).

PhysicalSample.name: DatumElevation_m
PhysicalSample.description: The point of reference against which elevation measurements are made. Best practice: use mean sea level (MSL) as datum.

PhysicalSample.name: SampledFeatureMinAge_Ma
PhysicalSample.description: Numerical value for the minimum age of a sample expressed in Ma (million years); ex: 4.2.

PhysicalSample.name: SampledFeatureMaxAge_Ma
PhysicalSample.description: Numerical value for the maximum age of a sample expressed in Ma (million years); ex: 4.2.

PhysicalSample.name: GeologicAge
PhysicalSample.description: Age of a sample as described by the stratigraphic  era, period, etc. “Cretaceous”; “Upper Miocene”.

PhysicalSample.name: SampledFeatureAgeLabel
PhysicalSample.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as geologic age.

PhysicalSample.name: AgeAssignmentBasis
PhysicalSample.description: Source of age dating: method or reference.

PhysicalSample.name: AgeUncertainty_Ma
PhysicalSample.description: For material without related laboratory age determination, provide an uncertainty statement.

PhysicalSample.name: CollectionActivityName
PhysicalSample.description: Free text name that should uniquely identify the collection activity (cruise, project, etc.) for human readers.

PhysicalSample.name: CollectionActivityURI
PhysicalSample.description: Identifier for cruise, project, program that is context for sample collection activity. Ideally should dereference to some standard representation(s) of the activity.

PhysicalSample.name: SourceCitation
PhysicalSample.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

PhysicalSample.name: SourceCitationURI
PhysicalSample.description: Identifier, DOI or other URI, for the cited source. Ideally an http URI that may be dereferenced to produce a representation of the original source document.

PhysicalSample.name: Registrant
PhysicalSample.description: Free text specification of party that originally registered sample; may be name or organization, with or without contact information.

PhysicalSample.name: RegistrantURI
PhysicalSample.description: Identifier for the party that originally registered the sample to create sampleURI.

PhysicalSample.name: UpdateDate
PhysicalSample.description: Date of last time line of data was updated or corrected by the service provider.(Format: 2012-06-22T00:00).

PhysicalSample.name: RelatedResources
PhysicalSample.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

PhysicalSample.name: Notes
PhysicalSample.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for  related parties (original collector, project PI, collection platform or Launch, etc.

PhysicalSample.name: Shape
PhysicalSample.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: physicalsample

description: Specific liquid and gas analyte suites in this workbook have been tailored for use in the analysis formulated by Powell and Cumming, 2010. Analytes reported with this content model match those in the Powell and Cumming, 2010 spreadsheets and can be directly inputted into their model, which creates numerous ternary diagrams and other Excel graphics to create a geothermomerty report. Citation: Powell, Tom and Cumming, William 2010. Spreadsheets for Geothermal Water and Gas Geochemistry. Thirty-Fifth Workshop on Geothermal Reservoir Engineering Stanford University, Stanford, California, February 1-3, 2010. SGP-TR-188.  Access the paper and spreadsheets (to generate report) here: http://repository.stategeothermaldata.org/repository/resource/9e15e1a59b....
title: Powell and Cumming Geothermometry
discussion: Note that version 2.0 succeeds previous versions due to the name change from PowellCummingsGeothermometry to PowellCummingGeothermometry.

GasAnalysis.name: OBJECTID
GasAnalysis.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

GasAnalysis.name: AnalysisURI
GasAnalysis.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

GasAnalysis.name: AnalysisName
GasAnalysis.description: Other human-intelligible labels for analysis such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. (If there are multiple analyses performed on a single sample, each analysis would correspond to a new line of data in the template.)

GasAnalysis.name: Notes
GasAnalysis.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about methods, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

GasAnalysis.name: SamplingFeatureName
GasAnalysis.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

GasAnalysis.name: SamplingFeatureURI
GasAnalysis.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

GasAnalysis.name: OtherSiteID
GasAnalysis.description: Additional information or more geographic names associated with sample collection location; if multiple names supplied, delimit with pipe '|' character, e.g. Arizona | La Paz County | Harquahala Mountains | Browns Canyon.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenID
GasAnalysis.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

GasAnalysis.name: Label
GasAnalysis.description: Short text string to identify/characterize the samples used in this observation; may include one or more sample names as provided by the sample collector or analyzing laboratory.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenDescription
GasAnalysis.description: Free text description of sample, including size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenURI
GasAnalysis.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
GasAnalysis.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
GasAnalysis.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures.

GasAnalysis.name: OtherAnalyticalData
GasAnalysis.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

GasAnalysis.name: FluidTemperature_C
GasAnalysis.description: Temperature, in decimal format. Degrees Celsius is preferred and will be reported for consistency in service implementations.

GasAnalysis.name: Discharge
GasAnalysis.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

GasAnalysis.name: DischargeUnits
GasAnalysis.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

GasAnalysis.name: County
GasAnalysis.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

GasAnalysis.name: State
GasAnalysis.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

GasAnalysis.name: LatDegree
GasAnalysis.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GasAnalysis.name: LongDegree
GasAnalysis.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GasAnalysis.name: SRS
GasAnalysis.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

GasAnalysis.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
GasAnalysis.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

GasAnalysis.name: PLSSMeridians
GasAnalysis.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

GasAnalysis.name: Township
GasAnalysis.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

GasAnalysis.name: Range
GasAnalysis.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

GasAnalysis.name: Section_
GasAnalysis.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

GasAnalysis.name: SectionPart
GasAnalysis.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

GasAnalysis.name: Elevation
GasAnalysis.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

GasAnalysis.name: ElevationDatum
GasAnalysis.description: The point of reference against which elevation measurements are made. Best practice: use mean sea level (MSL) as datum.

GasAnalysis.name: ElevationUnits
GasAnalysis.description: Units used to report all elevation and depth information.

GasAnalysis.name: Source
GasAnalysis.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

GasAnalysis.name: MetadataURI
GasAnalysis.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

GasAnalysis.name: AnalysisType
GasAnalysis.description: Type of analysis used to obtain the results in this record.

GasAnalysis.name: AnalysisDate
GasAnalysis.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GasAnalysis.name: Laboratory
GasAnalysis.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

GasAnalysis.name: ProcedureSummary
GasAnalysis.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

GasAnalysis.name: DataEntrySource
GasAnalysis.description: Person or organization responsible for data entry.

GasAnalysis.name: CO2_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: H2S_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: NH3_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: Ar_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: N2_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: CH4_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: He_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.description: Additional information or more geographic names associated with sample collection location; if multiple names supplied, delimit with pipe '|' character, e.g. Arizona | La Paz County | Harquahala Mountains | Browns Canyon.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenID
GasAnalysis.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

GasAnalysis.name: Label
GasAnalysis.description: Short text string to identify/characterize the samples used in this observation; may include one or more sample names as provided by the sample collector or analyzing laboratory.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenDescription
GasAnalysis.description: Free text description of sample, including size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenURI
GasAnalysis.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
GasAnalysis.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GasAnalysis.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
GasAnalysis.description: Text description of the process used to collect the analyzed specimen. Include any keywords that may typically be used to categorize sampling procedures.

GasAnalysis.name: OtherAnalyticalData
GasAnalysis.description: Text describing other analytical data associated with the analyzed specimen. Best practice: include a URI for observation records reporting related results.

GasAnalysis.name: FluidTemperature_C
GasAnalysis.description: Temperature, in decimal format. Degrees Celsius is preferred and will be reported for consistency in service implementations.

GasAnalysis.name: Discharge
GasAnalysis.description: Average measured volume of water per unit of time.

GasAnalysis.name: DischargeUnits
GasAnalysis.description: Units for flow rate, either gallons per minute (gpm) or liters per minute (lpm).

GasAnalysis.name: County
GasAnalysis.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

GasAnalysis.name: State
GasAnalysis.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

GasAnalysis.name: LatDegree
GasAnalysis.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GasAnalysis.name: LongDegree
GasAnalysis.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

GasAnalysis.name: SRS
GasAnalysis.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

GasAnalysis.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
GasAnalysis.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

GasAnalysis.name: PLSSMeridians
GasAnalysis.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

GasAnalysis.name: Township
GasAnalysis.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

GasAnalysis.name: Range
GasAnalysis.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

GasAnalysis.name: Section_
GasAnalysis.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

GasAnalysis.name: SectionPart
GasAnalysis.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

GasAnalysis.name: Elevation
GasAnalysis.description: Elevation at ground level for the feature. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

GasAnalysis.name: ElevationDatum
GasAnalysis.description: The point of reference against which elevation measurements are made. Best practice: use mean sea level (MSL) as datum.

GasAnalysis.name: ElevationUnits
GasAnalysis.description: Units used to report all elevation and depth information.

GasAnalysis.name: Source
GasAnalysis.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature or record; may be author-date type citation, well log, report, data files etc., but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

GasAnalysis.name: MetadataURI
GasAnalysis.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

GasAnalysis.name: AnalysisType
GasAnalysis.description: Type of analysis used to obtain the results in this record.

GasAnalysis.name: AnalysisDate
GasAnalysis.description: Date for the record: date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

GasAnalysis.name: Laboratory
GasAnalysis.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

GasAnalysis.name: ProcedureSummary
GasAnalysis.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

GasAnalysis.name: DataEntrySource
GasAnalysis.description: Person or organization responsible for data entry.

GasAnalysis.name: CO2_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: H2S_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: NH3_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: N2_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: CH4_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: He_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.name: CO_mgL
GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

GasAnalysis.description: Report analyte in mg/L.

status: This content model is still currently under review with the GDSDPWG working group. Version 1.0 is the most updated version; please use this version for services.
description: This workbook documents a content model for reporting electrical power production. In the context of NGDS, these will normally be geothermal power plants, but the content model is not unique to a single power plant type.
title: Power Plant Production

PlantProduction.name: OBJECTID
PlantProduction.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

PlantProduction.name: PlantProductionStatURI
PlantProduction.description: Unique identifier for this observation. This is the identifier (Uniform Resource Identifier) that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

PlantProduction.name: PlantProductionStatLabel
PlantProduction.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

PlantProduction.name: PowerPlantFacilityURI
PlantProduction.description: Unique identifier that specifies the feature represented: e.g. a geologic feature, aquifer or facility structure. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

PlantProduction.name: PlantName
PlantProduction.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature  is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

PlantProduction.name: OtherID
PlantProduction.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. 'Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

PlantProduction.name: Notes
PlantProduction.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

PlantProduction.name: PlantType
PlantProduction.description: Dry Steam; Flash Steam; Binary Cycle; Single Flash; Double Flash. If Unknown or missing place "nil:missing" or "nil:unknown"

PlantProduction.name: YearCommissioned
PlantProduction.description: Date for the record (year in which the first power plant at the site began operation). Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

PlantProduction.name: UTM_E
PlantProduction.description: UTM easting coordinate as decimal number.

PlantProduction.name: UTM_N
PlantProduction.description: UTM northing coordinate as decimal number.

PlantProduction.name: UTMDatumZone
PlantProduction.description: The datum and UTM zone for the reported coordinates. Datum for most locations should be NAD27 or NAD83.

PlantProduction.name: PostalAddress
PlantProduction.description: Postal address for facility. Street, City.

PlantProduction.name: County
PlantProduction.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

PlantProduction.name: State
PlantProduction.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

PlantProduction.name: LatDegree
PlantProduction.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

PlantProduction.name: LongDegree
PlantProduction.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

PlantProduction.name: SRS
PlantProduction.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

PlantProduction.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
PlantProduction.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

PlantProduction.name: ReportingPeriod
PlantProduction.description: Time interval of reporting period: year, month, week or day.

PlantProduction.name: StartReportInterval
PlantProduction.description: Date reporting period for this observation record starts (Format: 2012-06-22T00:00). If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

PlantProduction.name: EndReportInterval
PlantProduction.description: Date reporting period for this observation record ends (Format: 2012-06-22T00:00). If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

PlantProduction.name: ReportYear
PlantProduction.description: Production year of data reported, formatted 'YYYY'.

PlantProduction.name: Capacity_MW
PlantProduction.description: Nameplate capacity of the power plant in MW. Included as a search parameter.

PlantProduction.name: GrossProduction_MWhr
PlantProduction.description: Reported gross production from the power plant for the reporting period in MWhr.

PlantProduction.name: NetProduction_MWhr
PlantProduction.description: Reported net production (minus any parasitic loads) from the power plant for the reporting period in MWhr.

PlantProduction.name: AveragePrice_ckWh
PlantProduction.description: Total net production for the state divided by the gross receipts reported by the state department of taxation. Units are cents per kilowatt-hour.

PlantProduction.name: RelatedResource
PlantProduction.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

PlantProduction.name: MetadataURI
PlantProduction.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

PlantProduction.name: UpdateTimeStamp
PlantProduction.description: Date of last time line of data was updated or corrected by the service provider.(Format: 2012-06-22T00:00).

PlantProduction.name: Shape
PlantProduction.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: PowerPlantProduction

status: This content model is still currently under review with the GDSDPWG working group.
description: This workbook documents a content model for interchange documents with data from measurements of Radiogenic Heat Production based on analysis of individual rock samples. Calculation of heat production is based on measured U, Th, and K content, which may derive from chemical analysis, gamma ray spectral analysis or other techniques. Measurement procedures, including instruments used, standards used to calibrate calculation of U, Th, and K, assumptions in calculation of heat production from radiogenic element concentrations, etc. should be carefully described in the Measurement procedure field.
title: Radiogenic Heat Production

RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Short text string to identify/characterize the samples used in this observation; may include one or more sample names as provided by the sample collector or analyzing laboratory.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SpecimenURI
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: GeologicUnitName
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Name of geologic unit that was sampled. Include hierarchy of names if the unit is part of a higher-rank geologic unit, e.g. Group name/Formation name, or Formation/Member, or Group/ Formation. Spell out unit names in full.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: FeatureOfInterestURI
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Unique identifier that specifies the feature represented: e.g. a geologic feature, aquifer or facility structure. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: LithologyTerm
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Description of the lithology of surface geology or geologic column for well interval, e.g. arkose, granite, limestone, sandstone, schist. Recommend using CGI simple lithology vocabulary (see tab in this workbook). Use to account for EarthChem Material, EarthChem Type, EarthChem Composition, alluvium, 36-40': gravels; etc.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: RockName
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Free text name for lithology category of sample, e.g. biotite-hornblende granite, lithofeldspathic sandstone, calcareous arkose, biotite schist.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SamplingFeatureURI
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SamplingFeatureName
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Human-intelligible name of sample location, e.g.  well, outcrop, 'Exxon 1 Cochise well', 'Outcrop on Hwy 63 mile marker 125' etc. from which the specimen was obtained. If missing, use OGC nil value (see OGC_nilValues tab).

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SampleCollectionDate
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Date for the record (date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: LocalityTerms
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Additional information or more geographic names associated with sample collection location; if multiple names supplied, delimit with pipe '|' character, e.g. Arizona | La Paz County | Harquahala Mountains | Browns Canyon.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: TectonicProvince
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Tectonic division of a region based on geology.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: County
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: State
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: PLSS_Meridians
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Township
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Range
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Section_
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SectionPart
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: LatDegree
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: LongDegree
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SRS
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: ElevationDatum_m
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: The point of reference against which elevation measurements are made. Best practice: use mean sea level (MSL) as datum.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SampleDepth_m
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: If sample is from the surface enter zero, else put depth of formation sampled. Convert units to meters for data delivery.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SampleMeasurementDate
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Date for the record (date on which observation, measurement or test was made or specimen was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SampleType
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Type of material used for sample measurement. Category from simple material classification scheme e.g. rock, sediment, liquid, gas, biological material. DataValidTerms tab includes vocabulary used by SESAR (http://www.geosamples.org/), which is recommended for use here.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SampleMass_kg
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Weight of Sample measured. Convert units to kilograms.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: OverburdenThickness_m
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: If SampleType is surface in situ measurement, provide thickness of soil overburden at collection. Convert units to meters.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SampleDensity_g_cc
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Density of the rock sample or Bulk Density for Crushed/Cutting samples. Convert units to grams/cubic cm.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: UncertainDensity
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Free text qualitative or quantitative statement regarding the accuracy of the sample density or the method used to determine.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Laboratory
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: LaboratoryURI
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Unique identifier (if available) for the laboratory where the analysis was performed.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: RadioactivityMeasurementDevice
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Type of analysis/tool used on sample for the measurement: e.g. Gamma Ray Spectrometer-hand held, Gamma Ray Spectrometer - Laboratory, FUS-ICP, FUS-MS, other. If 'other', provide additional information in the MeasurementProcedure. Include device model number if available.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: MeasurementProcedure
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Methodology of radioactivity heat production measurement technique. If following a paper or standard include reference. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check. If device used was 'other', provide specific information here. Model name/number of any measurement device used may optionally be provided. Include sample preparation procedure (e.g. equilibration time for Rn decay), standards used to convert gamma ray counts to U,Th, K concentrations, gamma ray energies measured. Might include citation to published description of procedure if that is in a long-term persistent location.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: SampleCureDuration
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Duration of time between sample collection and measurement completion (in days).

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: MeasurementCount
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Total number of measurements made on this sample. Default is 1.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Uranium
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Measured Uranium Value in ppm. -999 if not measured.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Thorium
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Measured Thorium Value in ppm. -999 if not measured.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Potassium
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Measured Potassium Value expressed as a percentage. -999 if not measured, otherwise valid values are between 0 and 100.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: HeatProduction_mWm3
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Heat production value using procedure described in MeasurementProcedure field. Convert units to μW/m-3.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: HeatProductionUncertainty
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Free text qualitative or quantitative statement regarding the accuracy of the Heat Production Calculated Value and the method to determine the value. For example: Formula used (0.0000967*Uranium in ppm+0.0000263*Thorium in ppm+0.0035*(Potassium%/100))*Density in g/cm3.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Notes
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, measurements, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: MetadataURI
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Source
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining feature; may be author-date type citation, but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe ('|') character.

RadiogenicHeatProduction.name: Shape
RadiogenicHeatProduction.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: radiogenicheatproduction

status:
Currently deployed services are using the 0.4 version, and will validate against the newer v0.5 schema. A new Mineral Recovery Brines layer has been added to the 0.5 version.

 SLDs (Styled Layer Descriptors) can be downloaded from the State Geothermal Data Repository.  The Rock Chemistry model provides multi-feature web services represented by multiple layers. Thus, there are separate legends, each associated with a layer. Symbols were chosen arbitrarily.
description: This is a data interchange content model for an observation of the chemical composition of whole rock samples, including trace elements, gases, and isotopes. SamplingFeatureURI gives a unique identifier describing the geologic unit/formation described by the record, while ParentSampleURI indicates the unique identifier for the parent of the sample used in the analysis. Several 'suites' of analytes representing common analysis results are defined, with the intention that an implementation of the content model would offer several observation feature types, each of which consists of the header fields combined with the analytes for a suite. A content type for reporting results for a single analyte is also proposed, with an abbreviated header. In this approach a single analysis result is delivered as a collection of observation records, each with the same AnalysisURI and reporting single analyte. Suites were developed to match those in the EarthChem deployed services.
title: Rock Chemistry
discussion: RockChemistryAnalysis-Basic contains fields for information used to discover and retrieve chemical analyses meeting various criteria, and to evaluate the reported results. These fields would be reported along with a collection of analytes from the different suites proposed on the suites table.

USeries.name: OBJECTID
USeries.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

USeries.name: AnalysisURI
USeries.description: A unique identifier for a discrete analysis of a specimen taken from a feature. The feature from which the specimen was taken will be identified by its own URI.

USeries.name: AnalysisName
USeries.description: The human-intelligible name of the analysis. May be a concatenation of analysis type, feature name, and specimen label. This element is specific, not generic; i.e., do not use generic terms such as "Analyte Analysis".

USeries.name: OtherAnalysisID
USeries.description: Alternative identifier(s) for this analysis. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

USeries.name: Notes
USeries.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about methods, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

USeries.name: DetectionLimitURI
USeries.description: Unique identifier that specifies the Limits of the test. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the feature to other information related to this feature. Unique identifier for each set of samples, each analyzed using the same method, technique and using the same equipment.

USeries.name: SamplingFeatureName
USeries.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

USeries.name: SamplingFeatureURI
USeries.description: Unique Identifier for the particular site (station) or well where the sample(s) came from. For wells, this might be the HeaderURI or API number used in other metadata files. If unavailable, state 'missing'. SamplingFeature is a concept that represents the feature that accesses the part of the Earth from which the sample came, e.g. outcrop, borehole, dredge haul.

USeries.name: SpecimenID
USeries.description: ID given to the specimen by the collector(s). Recommended practice: include a short abbreviation in a prefix indicating the authority or scope of the identifier (e.g. 'usgs:'); any prefixes should be explained in the dataset metadata.

USeries.name: OtherSpecimenID
USeries.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

USeries.name: SpecimenURI
USeries.description: Unique identifier for sample; should include protocol prefix with known meaning, delimited by a ':' (colon), e.g. igsn:24623570 or http://resources.usgin.org/uri-gin/AZGS/sample/24623570.

USeries.name: ParentSampleURI
USeries.description: Identifier for a sample from which this specimen was sub-sampled. E.g. if a piece from a registered core is registered as a separate sample, this would be the identifier for the core.

USeries.name: Label
USeries.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

USeries.name: SpecimenCollectionDate
USeries.description: Date on which specimen sample was collected. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

USeries.name: SpecimenLabel
USeries.description: Short text string to identify/characterize the sample used in this observation; may include one or more sample names as provided by the sample collector or analyzing laboratory.

USeries.name: SpecimenDescription
USeries.description: Free text field for any additional observations or other information regarding the feature (size, weight, quality, lithology, locality, etc).

USeries.name: SampleCollectionMethod
USeries.description: Method used to collect specimen; may be hand sample, core or drill cuttings.

USeries.name: SpecimenType
USeries.description: Term to describe the type of specimen. Use term from list of Specimen types. If the specimen type collected is not present on this list, add the specimen type to the list in the example column.

USeries.name: SpecimenCollector
USeries.description: Free text specification of person, organization, affiliation, address, etc. for party that originally collected specimen. Include contact information if available.

USeries.name: MaterialClass
USeries.description: Category from simple material classification scheme e.g. rock, sediment, aqueous liquid, other liquid, gas, biological material.

USeries.name: LithologyTerms
USeries.description: Description of the lithology of surface geology or geologic column for well interval, e.g. arkose, granite, limestone, sandstone, schist. Recommend using CGI simple lithology vocabulary (see tab in this workbook). Use to account for EarthChem Material, EarthChem Type, EarthChem Composition, alluvium, 36-40': gravels; etc.

USeries.name: RockName
USeries.description: Free text name for lithology category of sample, e.g. biotite-hornblende granite, lithofeldspathic sandstone, calcareous arkose, biotite schist.

USeries.name: SampledGeologicUnit
USeries.description: Name of geologic unit that was sampled. Include hierarchy of names if the unit is part of a higher-rank geologic unit, e.g. Group name/Formation name, or Formation/Member, or Group/ Formation. Spell out unit names in full.

USeries.name: SampledGeologicUnitAge
USeries.description: Age of a sample as described by the stratigraphic  era, period, etc. “Cretaceous”; “Upper Miocene”.

USeries.name: County
USeries.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

USeries.name: State
USeries.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

USeries.name: LatDegree
USeries.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

USeries.name: LongDegree
USeries.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

USeries.name: SRS
USeries.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

USeries.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
USeries.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

USeries.name: LocalityTerms
USeries.description: Additional information or more geographic names associated with sample collection location; if multiple names supplied, delimit with pipe '|' character, e.g. Arizona | La Paz County | Harquahala Mountains | Browns Canyon.

USeries.name: DatumElevation
USeries.description: The point of reference against which elevation measurements are made. Best practice: use mean sea level (MSL) as datum.

USeries.name: Elevation
USeries.description: Elevation at ground level the sample came from. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

USeries.name: ElevationUnits
USeries.description: Units used to report all elevation and depth information.

USeries.name: Citation
USeries.description: Free text citation, using some standard journal format, that identifies a publication in which this sample was defined.  For samples that are not described in publications, text description of where sample came from should include name of person or organization to contact to access sample.

USeries.name: Source
USeries.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining feature; may be author-date type citation, but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe ('|') character.

USeries.name: MetadataURI
USeries.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

USeries.name: RelatedResource
USeries.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

USeries.name: AnalysisType
USeries.description: Type of analysis used to obtain the results in this record.

USeries.name: AnalysisDate
USeries.description: Date for the record (date on which measurement or test was made. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

USeries.name: Laboratory
USeries.description: If a Laboratory performed the analysis, include name and address here.

USeries.name: ProcedureSummary
USeries.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

USeries.name: UpdateTimeStamp
USeries.description: Date of last time line of data was updated or corrected by the service provider.(Format: 2012-06-22T00:00).
