status: This content model has been culled from the previous "Fluid Flux Borehole Observation" content model, along with the Geothermal Fluid Production and the Fluid Flux Injection and Disposal content models.  Version 1.0 has been submitted for NGDS technical team review, and the Excel workbook has been adopted for NGDS partner projects and posted on the NGDS web site resources/public documents section.
description:
This workbook documents a content model for exchange of information about fluid production for a given well. A generic  model is intended to allow for  a variety of flows from a well including oil, gas, and water as well as steam production. Because of the wide variety of possible flow measurements (commodities, aggregation type), the model adopts a thin approach, which may result in many records being returned for a single well. Thus most data about the well is linked through the HeaderURI instead of included inline to keep the redundant data volume down.

This template defines the content model for a service that delivers well fluid production observations. Many of these will be a standard map location and production volume, but other information may be delivered. The well fluid production content model is designed to be used for data compilation from publications, reports, and databases. This content model is intended to present key information necessary to query a well fluid production observation service and to evaluate the reported data.
title: Well Fluid Production

FluidProduction.name: OBJECTID
FluidProduction.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

FluidProduction.name: ObservationURI
FluidProduction.description: Unique identifier for this observation. This is the identifier (Uniform Resource Identifier) that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

FluidProduction.name: RecordName
FluidProduction.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

FluidProduction.name: Notes
FluidProduction.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

FluidProduction.name: Operator
FluidProduction.description: Name of company/organization that is operating the well during the reporting period.

FluidProduction.name: ProducingFeature
FluidProduction.description: Name of producing formation, named reservoir or pool, area, or field over which production is aggregated for this report. If a single well is reported, put 'well' here, and headerURI must be populated.

FluidProduction.name: HeaderURI
FluidProduction.description: Unique identifier for the borehole indicated by this record. This identifier should identify the physical well, based on the API number if available. Otherwise, the URI should incorporate one of the OtherID values. Please contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

FluidProduction.name: WellName
FluidProduction.description: Common or human-readable name by which the feature is known. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset.

FluidProduction.name: APINo
FluidProduction.description: API number for the the wellbore/borehole identified by the HeaderURI. If an API number is unavailable this field is empty. Usage of hyphens is optional, according to standard practice in each state. API number refers to the American Petroleum Institute number. Each oil, gas, or geothermal well drilled in the United States has a unique API number; this number identifies all boreholes or recompletions associated with the original wellbore. See http://www.spwla.org/technical/api-technical for more information about API numbering.

FluidProduction.name: OtherID
FluidProduction.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

FluidProduction.name: County
FluidProduction.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

FluidProduction.name: State
FluidProduction.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

FluidProduction.name: Field
FluidProduction.description: Name of the field in which the borehole is located. If multiple names are or have been used for the field, separate values with a pipe  '|' character.

FluidProduction.name: OtherLocationName
FluidProduction.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'.

FluidProduction.name: LatDegree
FluidProduction.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

FluidProduction.name: LongDegree
FluidProduction.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

FluidProduction.name: SRS
FluidProduction.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

FluidProduction.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
FluidProduction.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

FluidProduction.name: IntervalStartDateTime
FluidProduction.description: Start date and time for the production interval. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

FluidProduction.name: IntervalEndDateTime
FluidProduction.description: End date and time for the production interval. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

FluidProduction.name: DurationDays
FluidProduction.description: Duration of production interval described by this record. For interoperability, this interval should be reported in decimal days.

FluidProduction.name: Permit
FluidProduction.description: Permit for the fluid transfer activity during this reporting interval. Provide sufficient information to uniquely identify the permit.

FluidProduction.name: FluidType
FluidProduction.description: Please use Commodity of Interest vocabulary; if multiple fluids produced or injected during reported interval, separate with a pipe '|' character .

FluidProduction.name: FluidVolume
FluidProduction.description: Total fluid volume produced by the well during this reported production interval.

FluidProduction.name: FluidVolumeUnits
FluidProduction.description: Unit of measurement used; for liquids the preference is 'gallon'.

FluidProduction.name: Temperature_F
FluidProduction.description: Average temperature, in decimal format, of the fluid produced by the well over the course of this production interval. Use Fahrenheit units.

FluidProduction.name: Pressure_psi
FluidProduction.description: Report the pressure of fluid; measurement method should specify wellhead, formation, or other pressure measurement; aggregationType reports whether this measurement is an average, peak, spot, etc. Nillable.

FluidProduction.name: AggregationType
FluidProduction.description: Term that specifies the method for recording the interval for temperature and pressure, e.g. minimum, maximum, average, spot.

FluidProduction.name: MeasurementMethod
FluidProduction.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

FluidProduction.name: ContactIntervalTop
FluidProduction.description: Top of interval in well from which fluid is produced.

FluidProduction.name: ContactIntervalBottom
FluidProduction.description: Bottom of interval in well from which fluid is produced.

FluidProduction.name: Source
FluidProduction.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature; may be author-date type citation, but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

FluidProduction.name: MetadataURI
FluidProduction.description: URI identifying (and ideally dereferencing to get) a full formal metadata record for the observation report. A time series of observations may all reference the same metadata record that provides contact information and details on procedure, etc.

FluidProduction.name: RelatedResources
FluidProduction.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

FluidProduction.name: Shape
FluidProduction.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: fluidproduction

description:
A well is a facility defined by its function to extract fluids from within the earth. A well may be a simple hole in the ground (generally not the kind of wells we're interested in here...), but in general will consist of a dug shaft or drilled borehole. Drilled wells may include one or more boreholes (well bores) that are accessed from the surface at an origin collar, which defines the origin of the well. Individual boreholes in the well my have origin points (collars) that are located within existing boreholes in the well (e.g. sidetracks). The most common situation, especially for water wells, is a well consisting of a single borehole with a collar that is coincident with the well origin.

Well header features represent individual wells, and are the anchor for a variety of observations and other features.
title: Well Header Observation
discussion:
The Well Header  URI for a particular well is the cross-referencing link (foreign key) used to associate the well record, temperature measurements, chemistry and other information from a particular well.  Each entry is for one well borehole. 

Multiple observations (such as: temperature observations, chemical analyses) from the same well would be entered on separate, appropriate spreadsheets/templates.  If these separate observations exist, there should be a link to them entered on the Well Header template, entered under Related Resources.

Wellheader.name: OBJECTID
Wellheader.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

Wellheader.name: HeaderURI
Wellheader.description:
Unique identifier for this observation. This is the identifier (Uniform Resource Identifier) that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

							If the API number indicates multiple instances of reentry, recompletion, sidetrack, etc., each instance is to have its own HeaderURI.  For example, the API number 42-501-20130-0300 indicates a well (42-501-20130) with three sidetracks, for a total of four total boreholes (-0000,-0100, -0200,-0300), each of which should have its own database record and HeaderURI.

Wellheader.name: WellName
Wellheader.description: Human-intelligible name by which the feature  is known. Convention for wellName is: Name = Operator + Well No. + Lease Owner. A well may consist of multiple boreholes (wellbores). If these are distinguished by different records in this table, they should have the same well names, but distinct BoreholeNames, and at least one identifier (APINo or OtherID) that is unique to the borehole.

Wellheader.name: APINo
Wellheader.description: API number for the the wellbore/borehole identified by the HeaderURI. If an API number is unavailable this field is empty. Usage of hyphens is optional, according to standard practice in each state. API number refers to the American Petroleum Institute number. Each oil, gas, or geothermal well drilled in the United States has a unique API number; this number identifies all boreholes or recompletions associated with the original wellbore. See http://www.spwla.org/technical/api-technical for more information about API numbering.

Wellheader.name: Label
Wellheader.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

Wellheader.name: OtherID
Wellheader.description: Alternative identifier(s) for the feature. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

Wellheader.name: OtherName
Wellheader.description: Other human-intelligible labels for feature such as secondary name or common name, other spellings. Indicate the authority from which the OtherName is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

Wellheader.name: BoreholeName
Wellheader.description: Human-intelligible name by which the borehole is known. Convention for wellName is: Name = Operator + Well No. + Lease Owner. A well may consist of multiple boreholes (wellbores). If these are distinguished by different records in this table, they should have the same well names, but distinct BoreholeNames, and at least one identifier (APINo or OtherID) that is unique to the borehole.

Wellheader.name: ParentWellURI
Wellheader.description: The unique identifier for the well that contains the wellbore identified by WellBoreURI.   If the WellBoreURI identifies one of several wellbores within a well, this element is mandatory. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the well.

Wellheader.name: Operator
Wellheader.description: Name of company/organization that is operating the well during the reporting period.

Wellheader.name: MineralOwner
Wellheader.description: Name of owner of mineral rights for the property that contains the borehole identified by the HeaderURI.

Wellheader.name: Driller
Wellheader.description: Name of contracting company that drilled the borehole.

Wellheader.name: LeaseName
Wellheader.description: Name or number of the lease of the borehole. Formatting and punctuation are not proscribed, but should be consistent within a dataset.

Wellheader.name: SpudDate
Wellheader.description: Date on which drilling of the well bore began. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1'. If year is unknown, enter 1900. All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm. This is intended as a searching aid.

Wellheader.name: EndedDrillingDate
Wellheader.description: Date on which drilling of the well bore ended.  Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1'. If year is unknown, enter 1900. All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm. This is intended as a searching aid

Wellheader.name: DrillingMethod
Wellheader.description: Basic drilling technology used in the creation of the borehole identified by the HeaderURI. See Data Valid Terms tab. It is possible to use multiple different drilling methods and technologies per borehole. Delimit multiple drilling methods with the '|' character.

Wellheader.name: WellType
Wellheader.description: Type of well that contains the borehole, at the time indicated in the StatusDate element.

Wellheader.name: Status
Wellheader.description: Status of the borehole at the time indicated in the StatusDate element. If unknown enter "unknown" in the field.

Wellheader.name: CommodityOfInterest
Wellheader.description: The commodity of interest associated with the borehole.

Wellheader.name: StatusDate
Wellheader.description: The status of the feature can change from time to time, thus it is useful to know the date on which a given status was reported. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

Wellheader.name: Function
Wellheader.description: Functional characterization of the borehole, at the time indicated in the StatusDate element.

Wellheader.name: Production
Wellheader.description: Term indicating the production results of the borehole, at the time indicated in the StatusDate element.

Wellheader.name: ProducingInterval
Wellheader.description: Name of producing interval or intervals in well; separate multiple interval names by pipe '|' character.

Wellheader.name: ReleaseDate
Wellheader.description: Date on which data for the borehole was or will be made public. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1'. If year is unknown, enter 1900. All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm. This is intended as a searching aid.

Wellheader.name: County
Wellheader.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

Wellheader.name: State
Wellheader.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

Wellheader.name: Field
Wellheader.description: Name of the field in which the borehole is located. If multiple names are or have been used for the field, separate values with a pipe '|' character.

Wellheader.name: OtherLocationName
Wellheader.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. Separate multiple keywords with the pipe '|' character.

Wellheader.name: PLSS_Meridians
Wellheader.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

Wellheader.name: TWP
Wellheader.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

Wellheader.name: RGE
Wellheader.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

Wellheader.name: Section_
Wellheader.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

Wellheader.name: SectionPart
Wellheader.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

Wellheader.name: Parcel
Wellheader.description: Legal parcel identifier, or block number, or other parcel or location identifier.

Wellheader.name: UTM_E
Wellheader.description: UTM easting coordinate as decimal number.

Wellheader.name: UTM_N
Wellheader.description: UTM northing coordinate as decimal number.

Wellheader.name: UTMDatumZone
Wellheader.description: The datum and UTM zone for the reported coordinates. Datum for most locations should be NAD27 or NAD83.

Wellheader.name: LatDegree
Wellheader.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

Wellheader.name: LongDegree
Wellheader.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

Wellheader.name: SRS
Wellheader.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

Wellheader.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
Wellheader.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

Wellheader.name: LocationUncertaintyCode
Wellheader.description: A controlled vocabulary term or code value specifying the location confidence, e.g. 1 = reported, 2= surveyed, 3= GPS. If such a code list or vocabulary is used, it must be added to the 'Data Valid Terms' sheet to enumerate the possible values and their meaning.

Wellheader.name: LocationUncertaintyRadius
Wellheader.description: Radius in meters) of circle of confidence for location. Ideally might represent some specific confidence criteria like 'radius of circle around reported location which which true location lies with 95% confidence', but such precision is rarely available.

Wellheader.name: DrillerTotalDepth
Wellheader.description: Length of borehole, from borehole origin to bottom of borehole.

Wellheader.name: DepthReferencePoint
Wellheader.description: Identifier for elevation datum to which other elevations are referred. Default shall be sea level (MSL) in decimal format.

Wellheader.name: LengthUnits
Wellheader.description: Units used to report all elevation and depth information, decimal meters or feet.

Wellheader.name: WellBoreShape
Wellheader.description: Term used to indicate the overall shape of the borehole identified by the HeaderURI, e.g. vertical, inclined down, curved, horizontal, inclined up, unknown.

Wellheader.name: TrueVerticalDepth
Wellheader.description: Vertical distance from bottom hole point to elevation of borehole origin.

Wellheader.name: ElevationKB
Wellheader.description: Elevation at kelly bushing for the borehole. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

Wellheader.name: ElevationDF
Wellheader.description: Elevation at drilling floor for the wellbore. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

Wellheader.name: ElevationGL
Wellheader.description: Elevation of borehole at ground level. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

Wellheader.name: FormationTD
Wellheader.description: Name of geologic unit at the bottom of the borehole.

Wellheader.name: BitDiameterCollar
Wellheader.description: Bit diameter at the origin of the borehole, reported in decimal format.

Wellheader.name: BitDiameterTD
Wellheader.description: Bit diameter at the bottom of the borehole, reported in decimal format.

Wellheader.name: DiameterUnits
Wellheader.description: Units of length used to specify diameters in this record. Inches or centimeters, in decimal units.

Wellheader.name: RelatedResource
Wellheader.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

Wellheader.name: Notes
Wellheader.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

Wellheader.name: CasingLogger
Wellheader.description: The deepest cased depth in the borehole encountered during the log run.

Wellheader.name: CasingBottomDepthDriller
Wellheader.description: Bottom of cased interval of the borehole as  reported by the driller.

Wellheader.name: CasingTopDepth
Wellheader.description: Top of cased interval of the borehole.

Wellheader.name: CasingPipeDiameter
Wellheader.description: Internal (ID) or external diameter (ED) should be noted. Units must be same as those used to report bit diameter (Diameter units column). Note that if there are different casing types over different intervals in the well bore, these should be noted in tuples delimited by the pipe character '|' as follows: {top-bottom1, diameter1, xD1 | top-bottom2, diameter2, xD2}.

Wellheader.name: CasingWeight
Wellheader.description: Casing pipe weight per length installed in the borehole.

Wellheader.name: CasingWeightUnits
Wellheader.description: Units for the reported Casing Weight: kg/m OR lbs/ft.

Wellheader.name: CasingThickness
Wellheader.description: Thickness Casing pipe installed in the borehole. Units must be same as diameter units specified in this record. If multiple pipe thicknesses used, these should be separated by the pipe character '|'.

Wellheader.name: InformationSource
Wellheader.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature; may be author-date type citation, but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

Wellheader.name: Shape
Wellheader.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: wellheader

status:
Version 0.8 has been accepted as a content model for data delivery by an NGDS technical team review.

 

Example services:

ESRI REST pages:

  • CAWellLogs
  • ORWellLogs
  • WAWellLogs

 

Example WFS responses:

  • CAWellLogs
  • ORWellLogs
  • WAWellLogs
description: This workbook describes a content model for well log observation features. These will be point features that locate the well origin for a well bore from which a well log is available. The well log observation record describes the log (type, top and bottom of logged interval) and provides links to representations of the actual log data, which typically will be either a paper copy, scanned image, or LAS file. In some cases the log may be represented in an Excel Spreadsheet.   The content model includes basic information describing the well and well bore from which the log was obtained for use in search and filtering to discover logs of interest.  Each row in the WellLogObservationContent sheet in this workbook will correspond to an individual log from a borehole; thus there may be multiple rows per well. For logs that are scanned or digitized and available as online resources, Scanned File URLs will be provided. The WellBoreURI for the logged well bore is the cross-referencing link (foreign key) used to associate the header record, well log records, temperature measurements, and other information from a particular borehole.
title: Well Log Observation
discussion: Each line is for one log, and each well may have a variety of scanned log files (LAS, TIF, XLS, PDF).  These files are meant to be listed as separate records.

WellLog.name: OBJECTID
WellLog.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

WellLog.name: LogURI
WellLog.description: Unique identifier for the well log. This is the  Uniform Resource Identifier that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions. (See http://lab.usgin.org/node/315).

WellLog.name: OtherLogID
WellLog.description: Other identifier for the log, e.g. AmStrat log number. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the prefix would be azgs: and the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: DisplayName
WellLog.description: The label for portraying the feature identified by the HeaderURI on a map. A label may be the APINo (preferred), an OtherID or the WellName.

WellLog.name: Notes
WellLog.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

WellLog.name: LogTypeTerm
WellLog.description: Controlled vocabulary term to categorize the kind of log. Pick most specific category term (Data code) that applies from the vocabulary on the AASG Data Log Type Codes tab.

WellLog.name: LogTypeName
WellLog.description: Free text name for the type of log, using whatever terminology is used by the data provider. See AASG Data Log Type Codes tab for suggested terms.

WellLog.name: WellBoreURI
WellLog.description: Unique identifier for the well bore from which the log observation was obtained. Best practice is to use an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the well bore. Note that the terms borehole and wellbore (PPDM usage) are often used interchangeably in USGIN - AASG geothermal data documentation. If no URI is available for well, use http://www.opengis.net/def/nil/OGC/0/missing.

WellLog.name: WellBoreName
WellLog.description: Common or human-readable name for well bore from which the well log was obtained. Recommend using only web-safe characters (a-z A-Z 0-9 _-.) in the name. Be consistent in the naming convention used within any given dataset. Suggested convention for wellName is: Name = Operator + Well No. + Lease (Mineral) Owner.

WellLog.name: APINo
WellLog.description: API number for the the wellbore/borehole identified by the HeaderURI. If an API number is unavailable this field is empty. Usage of hyphens is optional, according to standard practice in each state. API number refers to the American Petroleum Institute number. Each oil, gas, or geothermal well drilled in the United States has a unique API number; this number identifies all boreholes or recompletions associated with the original wellbore. See http://www.spwla.org/technical/api-technical for more information about API numbering.

WellLog.name: ParentWellURI
WellLog.description: The unique identifier for the well that contains the wellbore identified by WellBoreURI.   If the WellBoreURI identifies one of several wellbores within a well, this element is mandatory. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the well.

WellLog.name: Keywords
WellLog.description: Keywords to index this well log. Keywords provide a means to enable use of more controlled term lists to improve search precision. Names of the operator, lease owner and driller of the well bore might be included here. Suggest expanding abbreviations, avoid use of punctuation or special characters, separate keyword or keyword phrases with pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: SpudDate
WellLog.description: Date on which drilling of the well bore began. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1'. If year is unknown, enter 1900. All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm. This is intended as a searching aid.

WellLog.name: WellType
WellLog.description: Type of well that contains the borehole, at the time indicated in the StatusDate element.

WellLog.name: Status
WellLog.description: Status of the borehole at the time indicated in the StatusDate element. If unknown enter "unknown" in the field.

WellLog.name: CommodityOfInterest
WellLog.description: The commodity of interest associated with the borehole.

WellLog.name: StatusDate
WellLog.description: The status of the feature can change from time to time, thus it is useful to know the date on which a given status was reported. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

WellLog.name: Function
WellLog.description: Functional characterization of the borehole, at the time indicated in the StatusDate element.

WellLog.name: Production
WellLog.description: Term indicating the production results of the borehole at the time indicated in the StatusDate element.

WellLog.name: ProducingInterval
WellLog.description: Name of producing interval or intervals in well; multiple interval names separated by pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: County
WellLog.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

WellLog.name: State
WellLog.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

WellLog.name: Field
WellLog.description: Name of the field in which the borehole is located. If multiple names are or have been used for the field, separate values with a pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: OtherLocationName
WellLog.description: Names of geographic features associated with the site that will be useful as search criteria to locate the information for this site. If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'.

WellLog.name: PLSS_Meridians
WellLog.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

WellLog.name: TWP
WellLog.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

WellLog.name: RGE
WellLog.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

WellLog.name: Section_
WellLog.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

WellLog.name: SectionPart
WellLog.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

WellLog.name: Parcel
WellLog.description: Legal parcel identifier, or block number, or other parcel or location identifier.

WellLog.name: LatDegree
WellLog.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

WellLog.name: LongDegree
WellLog.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature; values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

WellLog.name: SRS
WellLog.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

WellLog.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
WellLog.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

WellLog.name: DrillerTotalDepth_ft
WellLog.description: Length of borehole, from borehole origin to bottom of borehole.

WellLog.name: WellBoreShape
WellLog.description: Term used to indicate the overall shape of the borehole identified by the HeaderURI, e.g. vertical, inclined down, curved, horizontal, inclined up, unknown.

WellLog.name: ElevationGL_ft
WellLog.description: Elevation of borehole at ground level. 3 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p.6). Elevations should be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL).

WellLog.name: TopLoggedInterval_ft
WellLog.description: Depth to the top of the logged interval (report in feet below ground level reported in the ElevationGL_ft field).

WellLog.name: BottomLoggedInterval_ft
WellLog.description: Depth to the bottom of the logged interval (report in feet below ground level reported in the ElevationGL_ft field).

WellLog.name: DateTimeLogRun
WellLog.description: Date on which measurement was made. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

WellLog.name: PaperCopyLocation
WellLog.description: Location where the hard copy of the well log is located if one is available. Multiple locations may be listed, delimited by pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: ScannedFileURL
WellLog.description: URL or 'live link' that will retrieve a digital file containing a scanned image of the log file on the World Wide Web. Multiple locations may be listed, delimited by pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: LASFileURL
WellLog.description: URL or 'live link' that will retrieve a digital version of the well log encoded as a LAS file on the World Wide Web. See http://www.cwls.org/las_info.php for details about the Log Ascii Standard (LAS) format, which is a commonly used interchange format for digitized well logs. Multiple locations may be listed, delimited by pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: OtherDistribution
WellLog.description: Other distributions of the well log.

WellLog.name: RelatedResource
WellLog.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (other logs, samples, pictures or other documents), if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: Source
WellLog.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature; may be author-date type citation, but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

WellLog.name: Shape
WellLog.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: welllog

status:
This content model supersedes the Drill Stem Test content model, which as too narrow in focus for the larger project. Please use this content model for a variety of well tests.

No services are yet deployed in this content model, but all future drill stem tests need to be deployed using this.
description: This template defines the content model for a service that delivers well stem test data collected during development of Oil and Gas wells. Normal drilling procedures control formation pressures and fluids through the use of a hydrostatic head. Well testing brings these formation pressures and fluids to the surface. Data collected during the test procedure will be provided through the well test feature service. Types of tests include Production, G10, Drill Stem, Drawdown, Buildup, and other well test types.
title: Well Tests
discussion: This spreadsheet defines the schema used for the interchange of well test observation results by the AASG geothermal data project for the National Geothermal Data System.   The HeaderURI for a particular borehole (well for simple wells) is the cross-referencing link (foreign key) used to associate the header record, well logs, temperature measurements, and other information from a particular borehole.

WellTest.name: OBJECTID
WellTest.description: Integer record count, added by ArcGIS servers during service deployment; not required but cannot be removed when deploying from ArcGIS feature class. Not user maintained, so this element appears in XML implementation but not in the Content Model Template.

WellTest.name: ObservationURI
WellTest.description: Unique identifier for this observation. This is the identifier (Uniform Resource Identifier) that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. This URI should incorporate the name of the  test. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

WellTest.name: WellHeaderURI
WellTest.description:
Unique identifier for this observation. This is the identifier (Uniform Resource Identifier) that will be used to cross-reference data, samples, and other observations to the observation represented by this record. Best practice is to define an http URI that will dereference to a normative description of the observation. USGIN URI's may be redirected to any URL using the http://resources.usgin.org redirector; contact the USGIN development team at AZGS for instructions.

							If the API number indicates multiple instances of reentry, recompletion, sidetrack, etc., each instance is to have its own HeaderURI.  For example, the API number 42-501-20130-0300 indicates a well (42-501-20130) with three sidetracks, for a total of four total boreholes (-0000,-0100, -0200,-0300), each of which should have its own database record and HeaderURI.

WellTest.name: WellName
WellTest.description: Human-intelligible name by which the borehole identified by the HeaderURI is known. Convention for wellName is: Name = Operator + Well No. + Lease Owner. A well may consist of multiple boreholes (wellbores). If these are distinguished by different records in this table, they should have the same well names, but distinct BoreholeNames, and at least one identifier (APINo or OtherID) that is unique to the borehole. Conditional obligation - If the HeaderURI identifies a borehole which is one of several within a well, then a BoreholeName is mandatory. Each borehole should have a unique BoreholeName. Separate multiple BoreholeNames with the pipe character '|'.

WellTest.name: APINo
WellTest.description: API number for the the wellbore/borehole identified by the HeaderURI. If an API number is unavailable this field is empty. Usage of hyphens is optional, according to standard practice in each state. API number refers to the American Petroleum Institute number. Each oil, gas, or geothermal well drilled in the United States has a unique API number; this number identifies all boreholes or recompletions associated with the original wellbore. See http://www.spwla.org/technical/api-technical for more information about API numbering.

WellTest.name: Label
WellTest.description: Short text string for labeling the feature on maps. Can be the same as feature name. A label may be an OtherLocationName, OtherID or the Name or some combination.

WellTest.name: OtherID
WellTest.description: Alternative identifier(s) for observation or site information. Indicate the authority from which the OtherID is derived with a short (lower case) prefix delimited by a colon ':' If identifiers from multiple different authorities are available, delimit these identifiers with the pipe character '|'. For example, if a well were known to the Arizona Geological Survey (AZGS) by the id number 1337, the identifier string would be azgs:1337. Any such prefixes used to scope identifiers should be explained in the dataset metadata.

WellTest.name: TestName
WellTest.description: The human-intelligible well test name using "well name (or a given test name) -test number- run number" used in providing a unique ObservationURI. Multiple test and/or runs  would each have a unique name.

WellTest.name: TestType
WellTest.description: Spell out the test type term; use controlled vocabulary, adding terms as needed.

WellTest.name: TestTypeDescription
WellTest.description: If 'Other' is indicated in TestType field, provide brief explanation and/or name of test.

WellTest.name: TestOperator
WellTest.description: Name person or company, either proprietor or lessee, actually conducting the well test identified by the ObservationURI. Note that Operator must be the active operator on the reported StatusDate. for water wells, operator is owner of well. Ideally might be an http URI that can dereference to description/metadata for operator.

WellTest.name: TestDateTime
WellTest.description: Date on which test was made. Day, month and year must be specified; Excel will display using ISO 8601 date and time (yyyy-mm-ddT:hh:mm) format. If only the year is known, enter month and day as 'Jan. 1', (or '1/1/', or '1-1-', or 'January 1,'). All dates will be converted to yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm.

WellTest.name: TestNumber
WellTest.description: Often there are multiple tests (and in the case of drill stem, nultiple runs within a test)  performed on a single borehole.  If this is the case, each test on a well can be assigned a number "1-1, 1-2 for "test 1 run 1" and "test 1 run 2", or just 1,2, 3... for a test or run only and notated in the report, etc.  The TestNumber is incorportated into the Test Name and ObservationURI for uniqueness.

WellTest.name: Field
WellTest.description: Name of the field in which the borehole is located. If multiple names are or have been used for the field, separate values with a pipe '|' character.

WellTest.name: County
WellTest.description: Required. County name. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. If offshore, specify 'offshore' in this field.

WellTest.name: State
WellTest.description: Required. State name without abbreviations. If unknown or not applicable use 'missing'. For offshore locations, specify the governing or nearest state and list the county as 'offshore'.

WellTest.name: PLSS_Meridians
WellTest.description: List north-south baseline and east-west meridian that Townships and Ranges are referenced to.

WellTest.name: TWP
WellTest.description: Township in PLSS grid, relative to reported baseline. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline and meridian. Recommend adding leading '0's so that all number strings are the same length (typically 2 or occasionally 3 digits). Examples 01N, 112S, 001N.

WellTest.name: RGE
WellTest.description: Range in PLSS grid, relative to reported meridian. Formatting and punctuation should be consistent for all locations referenced to the same baseline meridian. See instructions on TWP field.

WellTest.name: Section_
WellTest.description: PLSS section number. Must be numeric or null. Some surveys include half sections indicated by a 'nn.5' designation, where n indicates a number.

WellTest.name: SectionPart
WellTest.description: Subdivision of a PLSS section.

WellTest.name: Parcel
WellTest.description: Legal parcel identifier, or block number, or other parcel or location identifier.

WellTest.name: UTM_E
WellTest.description: UTM easting coordinate as decimal number.

WellTest.name: UTM_N
WellTest.description: UTM northing coordinate as decimal number.

WellTest.name: UTMDatumZone
WellTest.description: The datum and UTM zone for the reported coordinates. Datum for most locations should be NAD27 or NAD83.

WellTest.name: LatDegree
WellTest.description: Latitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

WellTest.name: LongDegree
WellTest.description: Longitude coordinate for the surface location of the feature (use center point for areas); values should be provided with at least 4 significant digits for sufficient precision (7 decimal places is recommended by the USGS (OFR 02-463, p. 6). Use decimal degrees.

WellTest.name: SRS
WellTest.description: The spatial reference system. It is recommended that an EPSG code be used to identify the SRS used to specify the location.  If an EPSG code is used, identify it as such with the prefix 'EPSG:' For common EPSG codes, see the Data Valid Terms tab. EPSG:4326 is the identifier for WGS84, and should be the text in this field. EPSG stands for European Petroleum Survey Group. EPSSG codes can be dereferenced by putting the code in this URL (replace 4326) http://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/4326/.

WellTest.name: LocationUncertaintyStatement
WellTest.description: Information on how the original location was determined, e.g.: 1:250,000 map, gps unit, Google Earth, PLSS Conversion, Spatial Datum Conversion, e.g., NAD27 to WGS84.

WellTest.name: TargetFormation
WellTest.description: Formation targeted for testing. Spell out formal or informal geologic unit/formation name. Separate multiple names by pipe '|' characters.

WellTest.name: TargetFeatureURI
WellTest.description: Unique identifier that specifies the feature targeted by this test: e.g. a geologic feature, aquifer or facility structure. Ideally, the identifier is an http URI that will dereference to a known, useful representation of the feature. This identifier will be used to cross reference the test to other information related to this feature.

WellTest.name: DepthTopOpenZone
WellTest.description: Depth to the top of the open zone of the test interval.

WellTest.name: ElevationTopOpenZone_msl
WellTest.description: Elevation of the top of the interval being tested. Relative to MSL.

WellTest.name: DepthBottomOpenZone
WellTest.description: Depth to the bottom of the open zone of the test interval.

WellTest.name: ElevationBottomOpenZone_msl
WellTest.description: Elevation of the bottom of the interval being tested. Relative to MSL.

WellTest.name: UnitsOfMeasure
WellTest.description: Units used to report all elevation and depth information, decimal meters or feet.

WellTest.name: DepthReferencePoint
WellTest.description: Identifier for elevation datum to which other elevations are referred. Default shall be sea level (MSL).

WellTest.name: FormationTD
WellTest.description: Name of geologic unit at the bottom of the borehole.

WellTest.name: HoleDiameter_in
WellTest.description: Diameter in decimal format of the open hole at the depth tested. If the hole is cased this would be the internal diameter of the casing.

WellTest.name: DrillPipeLength
WellTest.description: Total length in decimal format of the Drill pipe in the hole.

WellTest.name: DrillPipeInternalDiameter_in
WellTest.description: The internal diameter of the pipe in decimal inches.

WellTest.name: FlowHistory
WellTest.description: Long text field used to summarize flow history for test, as a series of records using this template (use pipe '|' character to separate records): operation | startTime | endTime |  duration | chokeSize | pressure | temperature | recoveryColumn |  recoveryType | note

WellTest.name: PressureInitialShutIn
WellTest.description: Initial formation pressure after the comparatively short shut-in period (commonly 5 to 10 minutes) following the initial flow period of a drill stem test.

WellTest.name: TimeInitialShutIn_min
WellTest.description: Initial shut in time duration in minutes.

WellTest.name: PreferredPressure
WellTest.description: Preferred pressure for formation to meet or exceed production goals.

WellTest.name: PressureFinalShutIn
WellTest.description: Pressure after the well has been completely shut in for a final period of time.

WellTest.name: TimeFinalShutIn_min
WellTest.description: Final shut in time duration in minutes.

WellTest.name: ShutInPressureMethod
WellTest.description: Descriptive term/Measurement procedure or method used to determine the shut in pressure. May be measured at wellhead or down hole/bottom hole. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WellTest.name: Units_Pressure
WellTest.description: UOM for all pressure entries: PSI (pounds per square inch) used primarily in the United States, or Pa (pascals) the International System of Units (SI) for pressure. Pa is equal to N/m2 or kg·m−1·s−2.

WellTest.name: HydrostaticPressure
WellTest.description: The pressure at any point in a column of fluid caused by the weight of fluid above that point. Weight of the drill fluid in the hole at the start of the test.

WellTest.name: HydrostaticPressureMethod
WellTest.description: Descriptive term/Measurement procedure or method of obtaining the hydrostatic pressure. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WellTest.name: EquilibriumPressure
WellTest.description: Final pressure determination for the tested unit, based on interpretation of measured pressures from test; intended to represent best estimate of equilibrium pressure. If there is a long shut-in time, the shut-in pressure should be close to the equilibrium pressure. Measurement unit used in exchange documents is pounds of pressure.

WellTest.name: EquilibriumPressureMethod
WellTest.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check.

WellTest.name: FlowPressureMin
WellTest.description: Minimum Flow Pressure in the pipe, reported in decimal format.

WellTest.name: FlowPressureMax
WellTest.description: Maximum flow pressure should be equivalent to PressureFinalShutIn; reported in decimal format.

WellTest.name: FlowPressureMethod
WellTest.description: Text description of how the measurement was made - instrumentation, logging rate, correction or extrapolation process, how time since circulation was determined, etc. Data provider should indicate QA/QC performed on the data, including individual or institution, time frame and depth of quality check. Separate different methods with a pipe '|' character.

WellTest.name: TestFluid
WellTest.description: Text field to report the drill test fluid used. Use Controlled Vocabulary.

WellTest.name: FormationTemperature
WellTest.description: Temperature of the geologic formation, in decimal format. Degrees Celsius is preferred and will be reported for consistency in service implementations.

WellTest.name: TemperatureCorrection
WellTest.description: Report the corrected formation temperature in this field.

WellTest.name: TemperatureFlowing
WellTest.description: Report the temperature of the fluid flowing from the well.

WellTest.name: Units_Temperature
WellTest.description: Temperature, in decimal format. Degrees Celsius is preferred and will be reported for consistency in service implementations.

WellTest.name: RelatedResource
WellTest.description: This may be one to many http links to resources (logs, pictures or other documents if available online. Should be an http:// address (URL)) related to the observation described in each record. Delimit multiple values with the pipe '|' character.

WellTest.name: Source
WellTest.description: Mandatory. Short text explanation of source of information defining this feature; may be author-date type citation, but should include some indication of how digital data originated. If unpublished data, provide researcher name, date and research institution for proper citation. Separate multiple citations with pipe '|' character.

WellTest.name: Notes
WellTest.description: Any additional information to be provided, including description and other data not captured by the template, details about collection method, contact information for related parties (original collector, project PI), collection platform or Launch, etc.

WellTest.name: Shape
WellTest.description: Added by GIS for WFS service; this element appears in the xml output, but is generated during service deployment from the latitude and longitude, therefore it doesn't appear in the template.

label: WellTest
